This is longer used and the multiple-message interface should be used.

subject: Don't use 'we'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-04 11:37:05.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/source/launch-instance-networks-selfservice.rst'], 'message': 'Don't use 'we'

The document used "The admin or other privileged

creation or add it later. In this case, we can

To use "we" in this case should be avoided.

Change-Id: Idae1b9459bbbc6452891e9864362903653927457
Closes-Bug: #1679584
(cherry picked from commit 5c91e66384fa16f1d1ac869682208f84c0a11d63)

commit_message:
Don't use 'we'

The document used "The admin or other privileged
user must include this option during network
creation or add it later. In this case, we can
add it to the existing provider provider network.".

To use "we" in this case should be avoided.

Change-Id: Idae1b9459bbbc6452891e9864362903653927457
Closes-Bug: #1679584
(cherry picked from commit 5c91e66384fa16f1d1ac869682208f84c0a11d63)

subject: Rename server arg in wait_for_interface_status method
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-03 15:37:23.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/waiters.py'], 'message': 'Rename server arg in wait_for_interface_status method

This is very minor, but the server formal argument to the
wait_for_interface_status method is actually a server id.

This changes the name of the parameter to be clear on the
type of that object, since it could easily be confused
with a full server response body dict.

Change-Id: Id7cab21ab75092226f0784877ae55f17e880229c
'}]
commit_message:
Rename server arg in wait_for_interface_status method

This is very minor, but the server formal argument to the
wait_for_interface_status method is actually a server id.

This changes the name of the parameter to be clear on the
type of that object, since it could easily be confused
with a full server response body dict.

Change-Id: Id7cab21ab75092226f0784877ae55f17e880229c

commit_message:
Enable libvirt coredumps & save to logs

With this flag devstack will enable coredumps for libvirt, which are
saved to /var/core.  Compress and save them to the logs.

Depends-On: If7cd54e804a5a389a0d82a325b58f5b41b8ef0db

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-16 17:51:51.000000000', 'files': ['specs/pike/approved/pxe-boot-instances.rst'], 'message': 'Configurable PXE Boot for Instances

PXE boot for Nova instances is a commonly requested feature (see references).
While several options exist today to PXE boot an instance, they all either
require hacky patches to Nova or have other usability drawbacks.  Having
PXE boot functionality built in to Nova itself would eliminate the need
for these various one-off solutions and improve user experience in situations
where PXE boot is required.

Change-Id: I190745baa037c4f71694ad19c9d0ee71fea02da4
'}]
commit_message:
Configurable PXE Boot for Instances

PXE boot for Nova instances is a commonly requested feature (see references).
While several options exist today to PXE boot an instance, they all either
require hacky patches to Nova or have other usability drawbacks.  Having
PXE boot functionality built in to Nova itself would eliminate the need
for these various one-off solutions and improve user experience in situations
where PXE boot is required.

Change-Id: I190745baa037c4f71694ad19c9d0ee71fea02da4

commit_message:
Add 'attributed-action-notifications' spec

This blueprint aims to add an 'initiator' field to the instance action
notification body. This will report the user that requested said action
on the instance.

Change-Id: Ic90530ffc1283bff5207c48313a38a875756fa65
Implements: bp attributed-action-notifications

use InfluxDB as a data source in Grafana.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-04 09:19:11.000000000', 'files': ['roles/libvirt/setup/overcloud/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Revert "Generate/inject instack.json if overcloud nodes"

This reverts commit 8d4c77328e221beaa18bafa56a4967841da9e5d9.

commit_message:
Revert "Generate/inject instack.json if overcloud nodes"

This reverts commit 8d4c77328e221beaa18bafa56a4967841da9e5d9.

The original commit breaks baremetal deployments using virt undercloud.
The instackenv.json is needed when overcloud_nodes is empty in the
baremetal case.

Change-Id: I50a5a7ccbacec3f9e0ae2ec00010e82626a60ab7

commit_message:
tempest: Switch to local copy of tempset/scenario/manager.py

The manager.py file was mostly literally copied from
tempest as of today. [1]  It's slightly modified to
appease N521 hacking check.

tempest/scenario/manager.py is not a part of tempest stable
interface for plugins. [2]

This was suggested on openstack-dev as a preparation for
the coming refactoring in tempest. [3]

As tempest is branchless, this change needs to be backported
to all relevant stable branches.

[1] d184d619d7adc6ab60055884515055a7f3cf7770
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/plugin.html#stable-tempest-apis-plugins-may-use
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-February/112938.html

Change-Id: I8c2bb8b7b02e5e755d64fd29f9d20a55dc75ccdd
(cherry picked from commit 29e0732f2af35ebebc465bca051415a58e522d85)

connection, in order to ensure that the add / update operations work
properly, since PyMI's and WMI's GetText_(1) outputs are different,
causing an issue on 2012.

Note(claudiub): The merge conflict resulted from the different line
endings in the file.

Conflicts:
	os_win/tests/unit/utils/compute/test_migrationutils.py
	os_win/utils/compute/migrationutils.py

(cherry-picked from commit 973f50ff1dedfee2718228e5bda12ed00940059d)

Closes-Bug: #1678968

Change-Id: I5542046375114c24387cbcfba0aa8528f8e0dd6d
"}]
commit_message:
Uses _compat_conn where WMI objects need to be updated or added

This patch only affects Windows / Hyper-V Server 2012.

On Windows / Hyper-V Server 2012_compat_conn represents the old WMI
connection, in order to ensure that the add / update operations work
properly, since PyMI's and WMI's GetText_(1) outputs are different,
causing an issue on 2012.

Note(claudiub): The merge conflict resulted from the different line
endings in the file.

Conflicts:
	os_win/tests/unit/utils/compute/test_migrationutils.py
	os_win/utils/compute/migrationutils.py

(cherry-picked from commit 973f50ff1dedfee2718228e5bda12ed00940059d)

Closes-Bug: #1678968

Change-Id: I5542046375114c24387cbcfba0aa8528f8e0dd6d

The 'hw:numa_mempolicy' parameter was never implemented and will likely

commit_message:
Fix additional mistakes in the NUMA spec document

The 'hw:numa_mempolicy' parameter was never implemented and will likely
never be, however, it's located in the 'implemented' folder suggesting
otherwise. Seeing as specs are as much a reference as anything, this
invalid information should not be retained. Correct this, taking the
opportunity to fix some other typo, line wrapping and general
formatting.

Change-Id: I4aca0073f1fa26ff0c3a34407370f6ba6d916879

subject: Add tunnel timeout for ui proxy container
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-31 03:36:27.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/add-tunnel-timeout-for-haproxy-ui-0705dfd671f9f487.yaml'], 'message': 'Add tunnel timeout for ui proxy container

Add an explicit tunnel timeout configuration option to increase the
tunnel timeout for persistent socket connections from two minutes (2m)
to one hour (3600s).  A configuration was already present to apply a
tunnel timeout to the zaqar_ws endpoint, but that only applies to
connections made directly to the zaqar_ws endpoint directly.  Since UI
now uses mod_proxy to proxy WebSocket connections for Zaqar, the timeout
is now applied for the same reasons to the ui haproxy server.

Change-Id: If749dc9148ccf8f2fa12b56b6ed6740f42e65aeb
Closes-Bug: 1672826
'}]
commit_message:
Add tunnel timeout for ui proxy container

Add an explicit tunnel timeout configuration option to increase the
tunnel timeout for persistent socket connections from two minutes (2m)
to one hour (3600s).  A configuration was already present to apply a
tunnel timeout to the zaqar_ws endpoint, but that only applies to
connections made directly to the zaqar_ws endpoint directly.  Since UI
now uses mod_proxy to proxy WebSocket connections for Zaqar, the timeout
is now applied for the same reasons to the ui haproxy server.

Change-Id: If749dc9148ccf8f2fa12b56b6ed6740f42e65aeb
Closes-Bug: 1672826

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-02 11:46:57.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/libvirt-emulator-threads-policy.rst'], 'message': 'Add support for image metadata

Many of the other "scheduler hints" (cpu_policy, cpu_thread_policy,
cpu_realtime_mask, serial_port_count, ...) accept both flavor extra spec
and image metadata properties as ways to configure them. This provides a
way for users to provide pre-packaged applications that will, for
example, always have pinned CPUs or always have N serial ports. The
emulator threads policy should also be configurable in the manner for
the exact same reason. Correct this oversight in the spec.

The property itself has changed names since the spec was written. This
is also corrected.

Change-Id: I11415a55119bf4ba929e0f27f869993449bf9c5f
Blueprint: libvirt-emulator-threads-policy
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for image metadata

Many of the other "scheduler hints" (cpu_policy, cpu_thread_policy,
cpu_realtime_mask, serial_port_count, ...) accept both flavor extra spec
and image metadata properties as ways to configure them. This provides a
way for users to provide pre-packaged applications that will, for
example, always have pinned CPUs or always have N serial ports. The
emulator threads policy should also be configurable in the manner for
the exact same reason. Correct this oversight in the spec.

The property itself has changed names since the spec was written. This
is also corrected.

Change-Id: I11415a55119bf4ba929e0f27f869993449bf9c5f
Blueprint: libvirt-emulator-threads-policy

subject: Change murano release model back to cycle-with-milestones
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-03 18:40:59.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/pike/murano.yaml', 'deliverables/pike/murano-dashboard.yaml'], 'message': "Change murano release model back to cycle-with-milestones

Change murano and murano-dashboard's release model back to
cycle-with-milestones. Team discussed this change back at the PTG.
Murano changed release model to cycle-with-intermediary during ocata
cycle, envisioning faster shorter releases.
We didn't have much activity during ocata however. We would like to
return to a more familiar and predictable release model.

Change-Id: I317c7eb3ffe4fe6e983ebfc779b12419336b0137
"}]
commit_message:
Change murano release model back to cycle-with-milestones

Change murano and murano-dashboard's release model back to
cycle-with-milestones. Team discussed this change back at the PTG.
Murano changed release model to cycle-with-intermediary during ocata
cycle, envisioning faster shorter releases.
We didn't have much activity during ocata however. We would like to
return to a more familiar and predictable release model.

Change-Id: I317c7eb3ffe4fe6e983ebfc779b12419336b0137

subject: Eventually consistent scheduler host state
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-22 07:40:22.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/eventually-consistent-scheduler-host-state.rst'], 'message': "Eventually consistent scheduler host state

Nova scheduler is planned to scale for a much larger cloud (~10k nodes) in the
coming cells v2, but the widely-used filter scheduler is still suffering from
performance issue even in 1000-node deployment. This issue is majorly caused by
the poor implementation of scheduler-cache update model, which causes a time
consuming database block during every decision making processes. So a
work-around caching scheduler is implemented which excludes the involvement of
database during request processing, and the throughput is boosted to about
*850%* [1] as a result . However, caching scheduler still has a very naive
cache update model which makes it unsuitable to the rapidly changing
compute-node resources, because it still refreshes its entire scheduler cache
from database periodically, and it's 60 seconds by default.

So we propose a new scheduler host manager driver to apply an eventually
consistent update model to scheduler host states. It excludes the involvement
of database during decision making like caching scheduler. But the scheduler
caches are always *almost* up-to-date because they receive incremental updates
directly from compute nodes, and the schedulers know whether their decisions
are successful or not in compute nodes. The throughput of a prototype
implementation [2] is boosted to at least *510%* [3] compared with the legacy
implementation in the same 1000-node simulation.

[1] Austin summit session
    https://www.openstack.org/summit/austin-2016/summit-schedule/events/7129
    or a brief introduction here: http://paste.openstack.org/show/494336
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/306301
[3] http://paste.openstack.org/show/494211

Change-Id: I2788d252563850c68019db740c1c46a01f913650
"}]
commit_message:
Eventually consistent scheduler host state

Nova scheduler is planned to scale for a much larger cloud (~10k nodes) in the
coming cells v2, but the widely-used filter scheduler is still suffering from
performance issue even in 1000-node deployment. This issue is majorly caused by
the poor implementation of scheduler-cache update model, which causes a time
consuming database block during every decision making processes. So a
work-around caching scheduler is implemented which excludes the involvement of
database during request processing, and the throughput is boosted to about
*850%* [1] as a result . However, caching scheduler still has a very naive
cache update model which makes it unsuitable to the rapidly changing
compute-node resources, because it still refreshes its entire scheduler cache
from database periodically, and it's 60 seconds by default.

So we propose a new scheduler host manager driver to apply an eventually
consistent update model to scheduler host states. It excludes the involvement
of database during decision making like caching scheduler. But the scheduler
caches are always *almost* up-to-date because they receive incremental updates
directly from compute nodes, and the schedulers know whether their decisions
are successful or not in compute nodes. The throughput of a prototype
implementation [2] is boosted to at least *510%* [3] compared with the legacy
implementation in the same 1000-node simulation.

[1] Austin summit session
    https://www.openstack.org/summit/austin-2016/summit-schedule/events/7129
    or a brief introduction here: http://paste.openstack.org/show/494336
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/306301
[3] http://paste.openstack.org/show/494211

Change-Id: I2788d252563850c68019db740c1c46a01f913650

subject: Improve Scheduler Logging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-23 17:39:58.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/improve-sched-logging.rst'], 'message': 'Improve Scheduler Logging

The nova scheduler includes a number of very complicated filters with
non-obvious failure modes (the NUMATopologyFilter in particular comes
to mind). It is possible to have a situation where a given instances
fails to schedule, and it is not immediately apparent as to what
exactly caused the failure.

Accordingly, it is proposed that we allow for optional detailed
messages about precisely *why* a scheduler filter is failing.

(This was originally approved for Newton, but the implementation
was not merged in time.)

Change-Id: I5cfc88b89f87b07dbceca031718c36c5ba0bada2
'}]
commit_message:
Improve Scheduler Logging

The nova scheduler includes a number of very complicated filters with
non-obvious failure modes (the NUMATopologyFilter in particular comes
to mind). It is possible to have a situation where a given instances
fails to schedule, and it is not immediately apparent as to what
exactly caused the failure.

Accordingly, it is proposed that we allow for optional detailed
messages about precisely *why* a scheduler filter is failing.

(This was originally approved for Newton, but the implementation
was not merged in time.)

Change-Id: I5cfc88b89f87b07dbceca031718c36c5ba0bada2

subject: Introduce context variable 'pypi_name'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-03 16:18:53.000000000', 'files': ['renderspec/__init__.py', 'tests.py', 'doc/source/usage.rst'], 'message': "Introduce context variable 'pypi_name'

It will be useful for future functions to know the pypi name inside
of the Jinja2 context. For that a variable must be set.
The first user of that variable is the context function py2name().
If this function is called without any parameter, the value from
'pypi_name' is used for the name calculation.
Also document the currently available context variables.

Change-Id: I92f6d59c287160e8677b2df3ce0a4411a95af760
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce context variable 'pypi_name'

It will be useful for future functions to know the pypi name inside
of the Jinja2 context. For that a variable must be set.
The first user of that variable is the context function py2name().
If this function is called without any parameter, the value from
'pypi_name' is used for the name calculation.
Also document the currently available context variables.

Change-Id: I92f6d59c287160e8677b2df3ce0a4411a95af760

commit_message:
Guard calls which won't work from within containers

Ensure that calls to setup live migration are not made if
the charm is running from inside a LXD container, as the
calls will fail (config needs to be done on the host, not
from within the container).

Change-Id: I1633ba0ef5030b4d170bcea9d0c90a781863b168
Closes-Bug: 1633633
(cherry picked from commit 8a7e9753c5c6c20d90ce15d84e9c54da63d39244)

subject: Enable WSGI mode in gate only
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-31 15:22:45.000000000', 'files': ['zun/tests/contrib/gate_hook.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': "Enable WSGI mode in gate only

In before, zun devstack plugin enabled wsgi mode by default. This
patch proposed the reverse: disable wsgi mode by default. This fall
back to the screen mode if users haven't explicitly set
ZUN_USE_MOD_WSGI to True. However, we enable wsgi mode in gate to
satisfy the requirement of community wsgi goal [1].

The rational of this change is to ease the development process by
running zun-api at screen, which is more dev-friendly than running
it in apache2/httpd. In screen, it is easier to do dev operations
like shutdown/restart/debug.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/pike/
    deploy-api-in-wsgi.html

Change-Id: I8b47a23e94de8676c415a66da2097fc69ceb8336
"}]
commit_message:
Enable WSGI mode in gate only

In before, zun devstack plugin enabled wsgi mode by default. This
patch proposed the reverse: disable wsgi mode by default. This fall
back to the screen mode if users haven't explicitly set
ZUN_USE_MOD_WSGI to True. However, we enable wsgi mode in gate to
satisfy the requirement of community wsgi goal [1].

The rational of this change is to ease the development process by
running zun-api at screen, which is more dev-friendly than running
it in apache2/httpd. In screen, it is easier to do dev operations
like shutdown/restart/debug.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/pike/
    deploy-api-in-wsgi.html

Change-Id: I8b47a23e94de8676c415a66da2097fc69ceb8336

monasca-notification: various fixes

* Add missing rcopenstack-monasca-notification symlink
  on SUSE
* Fix permissions
* Fixed duplicated creation of /var/log/monasca-notification
* Use an invalid email address in example configuration (rather
  than a hp.com one).

On Windows / Hyper-V Server 2012_compat_conn represents the old WMI

commit_message:
Uses _compat_conn where WMI objects need to be updated or added

This patch only affects Windows / Hyper-V Server 2012.

On Windows / Hyper-V Server 2012_compat_conn represents the old WMI
connection, in order to ensure that the add / update operations work
properly, since PyMI's and WMI's GetText_(1) outputs are different,
causing an issue on 2012.

Closes-Bug: #1678968

Change-Id: I5542046375114c24387cbcfba0aa8528f8e0dd6d

Idempotent id for tempest tests must be unique, as it's used to
trace tests even in the event of refactors. This patch adds a new

Change-Id: I415699d2349ee0c4becfb404c60a06f244f78ba0

commit_message:
Add check for idempotent id in tempest tests

Idempotent id for tempest tests must be unique, as it's used to
trace tests even in the event of refactors. This patch adds a new
check using check-uuid tool from tempest to validate id uniqueness.

Change-Id: I415699d2349ee0c4becfb404c60a06f244f78ba0

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-04 06:24:13.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/ceph/templates/ceph-osd.json.j2', 'ansible/roles/ceph/templates/ceph.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/ceph/templates/ceph-rgw.json.j2', 'ansible/roles/ceph/templates/ceph-mon.json.j2'], 'message': 'Fix ceph log location

There are to parameter for ceph-mon/ceph-osd/radosgw, "-f" and "-d".

    -d run in foreground, log to stderr.
    -f run in foreground, log to usual location.

When log tin stderr, docker engine will collect the logs. It is useless
and we should write the log into file only. Then stop writing log to
stderr.

ceph-mon log location is controlled by "mon cluster log file".

Change-Id: I7883a4316420bc2bf4c772cb7248b663359f54b7
Closes-Bug: #1677237
(cherry picked from commit 2947a95c291c0ddfbf60cd611f30f2ece6173098)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ceph log location

There are to parameter for ceph-mon/ceph-osd/radosgw, "-f" and "-d".

    -d run in foreground, log to stderr.
    -f run in foreground, log to usual location.

When log tin stderr, docker engine will collect the logs. It is useless
and we should write the log into file only. Then stop writing log to
stderr.

ceph-mon log location is controlled by "mon cluster log file".

Change-Id: I7883a4316420bc2bf4c772cb7248b663359f54b7
Closes-Bug: #1677237
(cherry picked from commit 2947a95c291c0ddfbf60cd611f30f2ece6173098)

puppet-tripleo where ceilometer::keystone::auth class
is initialized.

commit_message:
Fixes crash when starting Neutron OVS Agent on Windows

The neutron OVS Agent does not start on Windows because
of Linux specific import.

The fix consists in moving the method get_ip_version in
the common module of ip_lib being the only one used from
the module. We will import the common module
agent/common/ip_lib after that.

Change-Id: I95e9a6fa99e0992499f46a4f0debccd47b8a936c
Closes-Bug: #1670402

subject: Use HostAddressOpt for opts that accept IP and hostnames
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-28 03:36:54.000000000', 'files': ['fuxi/common/config.py'], 'message': 'Use HostAddressOpt for opts that accept IP and hostnames

Some configuration options were accepting both IP addresses
and hostnames. Since there was no specific OSLO opt type to
support this, we were using ``StrOpt``. The change [1] that
added support for ``HostAddressOpt`` type was merged in Ocata
and became available for use with oslo version 3.22.

This patch changes the opt type of configuration options to use
this more relevant opt type - HostAddressOpt.

[1] I77bdb64b7e6e56ce761d76696bc4448a9bd325eb

Change-Id: I66fb2097a4b6908fc6ee9f41ff141d3067a18a31
'}]
commit_message:
Use HostAddressOpt for opts that accept IP and hostnames

Some configuration options were accepting both IP addresses
and hostnames. Since there was no specific OSLO opt type to
support this, we were using ``StrOpt``. The change [1] that
added support for ``HostAddressOpt`` type was merged in Ocata
and became available for use with oslo version 3.22.

This patch changes the opt type of configuration options to use
this more relevant opt type - HostAddressOpt.

[1] I77bdb64b7e6e56ce761d76696bc4448a9bd325eb

Change-Id: I66fb2097a4b6908fc6ee9f41ff141d3067a18a31

commit_message:
Add device updating task status

Currently when we attach/detach volume and network
interface from instance, the task state of the instance
is unchanged, it cause some issues.

This specification purpose to add one new task state
"device_updating" into the instance life cycle.

APIImpact

blueprint task-states-improvement

Co-Authored-By: Kevin_Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: Ie53c71373269ffe732866da4e6cce7ded3a7b234

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-06 21:23:07.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Fix the check of docker installation

In before, we checked docker installation by:

  $ rpm -q docker-engine

However, this doesn't work for all cases in fedora 24.
* If docker was installed by "sudo dnf install docker-engine", the
  package will be named as "docker". Therefore, it should be checked
  by "rpm -q docker".
* If docker was installed by devstack (by using
  https://get.docker.com/), the package will be named as
  "docker-engine". Therefore, it should be checked by
  "rpm -q docker-engine".

This commit added check for "docker" as well.

Change-Id: If2fc8a9d210bb663bfd9780c564053a901327a20
Closes-Bug: #1647459
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the check of docker installation

In before, we checked docker installation by:

  $ rpm -q docker-engine

However, this doesn't work for all cases in fedora 24.
* If docker was installed by "sudo dnf install docker-engine", the
  package will be named as "docker". Therefore, it should be checked
  by "rpm -q docker".
* If docker was installed by devstack (by using
  https://get.docker.com/), the package will be named as
  "docker-engine". Therefore, it should be checked by
  "rpm -q docker-engine".

This commit added check for "docker" as well.

Change-Id: If2fc8a9d210bb663bfd9780c564053a901327a20
Closes-Bug: #1647459

We can analyze content in memory which is used by VM. If memory
is not cleared after deleting VM, this will cause a safety problem.
So we need VM's memoryclear function, memory used by VM will be

commit_message:
Clearing memory will be needed after deleting vm

We can analyze content in memory which is used by VM. If memory
is not cleared after deleting VM, this will cause a safety problem.
So we need VM's memoryclear function, memory used by VM will be
cleared to zero if memoryclear function is configured when creating
VM. And this will solve a safety problem of using VM.

Change-Id: I06e1968664cd5a2ef11861f770c8101238589ec1
Implements: blueprint clearing-memory-after-deleting-vm

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-27 06:26:16.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/time-sync-with-qemu-guest-agent-when-resuming-vm.rst'], 'message': "libvirt: Time synchronization with qemu guest agent when resuming VM

VM's clock always loses time when resuming from paused state, because
guest OS can't aware pausing/resuming so its clock continues
from the moment it was suspended.

commit_message:
libvirt: Time synchronization with qemu guest agent when resuming VM

VM's clock always loses time when resuming from paused state, because
guest OS can't aware pausing/resuming so its clock continues
from the moment it was suspended.

This specification proposes nova-compute libvirt driver should
invoke virDomainSetTime API to adjust guest time with hardware
clock when resuming VM.

Blueprint: time-sync-with-qemu-guest-agent-when-resuming-vm

Change-Id: I160c9469795ff73d89a251898c7d9390ad0b0e59
Singed-off-by: Taku Izumi <izumi.taku@jp.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Add ability to get device by mac_address

switch_info key in local_link_information is optional, and ironic-inspector
doesn't set this field by default. Whith this patch it is possible to
pick device based on 'switch_id' key. For this device in ngs config must
have option 'ngs_mac_address' set. If 'switch_id' is set it will take
precedence over switch_info.

Change-Id: I0a03501701d2fd199af1df570e36a6d2a9df1250

commit_message:
Spec for supporting authentication methods based on image metadata

Nova should be able to accept or reject 'create' or 'recreate' API
calls, and respond with the appropriate HTTP response code, based on
image metadata and data supplied with the request.

Co-Authored-By: Aline Bousquet <albousque@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I4b4f19609d85c2a1aa40d45c6a54bf0cea64781a

subject: Share get_all_host_states with concurrent requests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-22 07:28:28.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/prune-scheduler-cache-refresh.rst'], 'message': 'Share get_all_host_states with concurrent requests

This blueprint proposes an optimization to let concurrent request reuse the
return value of "get_all_host_states", so the host manager only need to build
host states once for all the incoming cache-refresh operations during the
building. This optimization can provide the freshest host states as before,
while minimize the database overhead from scheduler service, and accelerate
concurrent cache-refresh operations. It enables filter scheduler to support
much more compute nodes and heavier schedule workload.

Change-Id: I7e76ea526fd9df661e4f3d001b3101d5d9b2a9f1
Blueprint: prune-scheduler-cache-refresh
'}]
commit_message:
Share get_all_host_states with concurrent requests

This blueprint proposes an optimization to let concurrent request reuse the
return value of "get_all_host_states", so the host manager only need to build
host states once for all the incoming cache-refresh operations during the
building. This optimization can provide the freshest host states as before,
while minimize the database overhead from scheduler service, and accelerate
concurrent cache-refresh operations. It enables filter scheduler to support
much more compute nodes and heavier schedule workload.

Change-Id: I7e76ea526fd9df661e4f3d001b3101d5d9b2a9f1
Blueprint: prune-scheduler-cache-refresh

commit_message:
Move Cinder admin tests into unversioned path

As http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/114507.html
we will use the existing Cinder V2 API tests for testing the base
microversion of Cinder V3 API also.
So it is not necessary to contain versioned path in test module pathes.
This patch just moves Cinder admin tests to unversioned pathes.

Change-Id: I2acfe5a28a2533b16565e6ebad5c820e7c3a3967

commit_message:
Use stevedore for plugin config of block device

This patch introduces stevedore plugin mechanism for use
with the block device layer.  This makes it possible that
other projects pass in their own block device plugins.

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-01 12:58:01.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/api-support-image-signing.rst'], 'message': 'API support for image signing

This spec describes a change to the "show" method
of the compute service API. If Nova verified the
signature of an instance's disk image prior to boot,
information about the certificate chain used to
verify the signature will be stored by Nova and
included in the "show" response.

Change-Id: I23b6eeef2e00042ca605e04cf5a97b79c9a5cc97
'}]
commit_message:
API support for image signing

This spec describes a change to the "show" method
of the compute service API. If Nova verified the
signature of an instance's disk image prior to boot,
information about the certificate chain used to
verify the signature will be stored by Nova and
included in the "show" response.

Change-Id: I23b6eeef2e00042ca605e04cf5a97b79c9a5cc97

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-25 21:04:41.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/mix-and-match-resource-federation.rst'], 'message': 'Propose resource federation for block devices

Enables use of block device resources across OpenStack installations linked
with K2K authentication.  In particular, it enables the following use cases:

* Attaching and detaching remote volumes
* Booting from a remote image
* Attaching remote volumes at boot using the block-device-manager interface

Change-Id: Icc2fcfe30f466d947bc752b3e0dc93cc4187ee6b
'}]
commit_message:
Propose resource federation for block devices

Enables use of block device resources across OpenStack installations linked
with K2K authentication.  In particular, it enables the following use cases:

* Attaching and detaching remote volumes
* Booting from a remote image
* Attaching remote volumes at boot using the block-device-manager interface

Change-Id: Icc2fcfe30f466d947bc752b3e0dc93cc4187ee6b

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-31 17:30:10.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Remove 'reverify'

'recheck' and 'reverify' do exactly the same since
Ifbb5c67894cb436b11f69aff2d9da1140dcdaa55 from July 2014.

It's time to reverify, people are still expecting that the old behaviour
works.

Mailing list message sent to openstack-dev:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/114828.html

Change-Id: I017f3eb9666e1b55203a05aba2fc9a3ba77af585
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 'reverify'

'recheck' and 'reverify' do exactly the same since
Ifbb5c67894cb436b11f69aff2d9da1140dcdaa55 from July 2014.

It's time to reverify, people are still expecting that the old behaviour
works.

Mailing list message sent to openstack-dev:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/114828.html

Change-Id: I017f3eb9666e1b55203a05aba2fc9a3ba77af585

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-04-03 14:36:02.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/base.py', 'mistral_tempest_tests/tests/api/v2/test_action_executions.py', 'mistral/actions/std_actions.py'], 'message': 'Change Http action result content encoding

Sometimes action result is present not in "utf-8", it cases
to "UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf8' codec can't decode byte" so
need to pass proper encoding format in serialiser and deserialiser
if it is different from default, but it should be resolved in
general as a fix for another bug (#1676411).

As a hotfix for linked bug, encoding was changed in the
run Http action method directly.

Also default encoding value in the FakeHTTPResponse was changed

Closes-Bug: #1667415
'}]
commit_message:
Change Http action result content encoding

Sometimes action result is present not in "utf-8", it cases
to "UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf8' codec can't decode byte" so
need to pass proper encoding format in serialiser and deserialiser
if it is different from default, but it should be resolved in
general as a fix for another bug (#1676411).

As a hotfix for linked bug, encoding was changed in the
run Http action method directly.

Also default encoding value in the FakeHTTPResponse was changed
from 'utf8' to 'utf-8' like in official python request lib docs.

Change-Id: I0ab9ec84c0973f362b57ab82248f27768a984678
Closes-Bug: #1667415

commit_message:
Add read-only tests for cephx access rules

In the Newton cycle the ability to create read-only rules for
cephx-backed access rules was added but there were no functional tests
to exercise this feature. This patchset adds new parameters to the
existing cephx access rule test to also test read-only rules.

Change-Id: I4b4fd5790526ebc596471fd913ffe9cdb2faa520

subject: Keep scenario manager temporary copy for plugins
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-01 02:52:47.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_aggregates_basic_ops.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_object_storage_basic_ops.py', 'tempest/scenario/manager.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_volume_migrate_attached.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_network_basic_ops.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_network_v6.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_security_groups_basic_ops.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_snapshot_pattern.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_minimum_basic.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_server_basic_ops.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_volume_boot_pattern.py', 'tempest/scenario/base.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_encrypted_cinder_volumes.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_network_advanced_server_ops.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_server_multinode.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_server_advanced_ops.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_shelve_instance.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_stamp_pattern.py'], 'message': 'Keep scenario manager temporary copy for plugins

As scenario manager class is mess and already under
refactoring, almost all the plugins use that class
for their scenario testing.

Refactoring will defiantly impact their tests and waiting
for each plugins to fix their usage on every tempest refactor
patch will leads to delay in works.

This commits propose to keep the current scenario manager
temporary copy in Tempest and work on new scenario base class
(which is copy of scenario manager in tempest) to make
it scenario tests in good shape.

Once Tempest will be done with refactoring and ready with stable
interface or helpers required for scenario testing, temporary
scenario manager class will be removed with deprecation period.

This way gives benefits like:
1. We can merge the Tempest refactoring work fast without
   breaking any plugins.
2. Plugins will switch to new helpers or stable interfaces in one shot
   instead of keep changing their usage on every tempest refactor change.

Other way is to ask each plugins to keep scenario managers local copy
but that needs changes in each plugins.

ref- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-February/112902.html

Change-Id: I941ec1e5e0f3c1ad8fb609de7ad7081ae9653967
'}]
commit_message:
Keep scenario manager temporary copy for plugins

As scenario manager class is mess and already under
refactoring, almost all the plugins use that class
for their scenario testing.

Refactoring will defiantly impact their tests and waiting
for each plugins to fix their usage on every tempest refactor
patch will leads to delay in works.

This commits propose to keep the current scenario manager
temporary copy in Tempest and work on new scenario base class
(which is copy of scenario manager in tempest) to make
it scenario tests in good shape.

Once Tempest will be done with refactoring and ready with stable
interface or helpers required for scenario testing, temporary
scenario manager class will be removed with deprecation period.

This way gives benefits like:
1. We can merge the Tempest refactoring work fast without
   breaking any plugins.
2. Plugins will switch to new helpers or stable interfaces in one shot
   instead of keep changing their usage on every tempest refactor change.

Other way is to ask each plugins to keep scenario managers local copy
but that needs changes in each plugins.

ref- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-February/112902.html

Change-Id: I941ec1e5e0f3c1ad8fb609de7ad7081ae9653967

commit_message:
Configure identity_uri with authtoken resource

This configuration option is used for the authentication plugin in
the authtoken middleware. It's used in favor of configuring it using the
host fragments, as referenced in the keystonemiddleware documentation.

subject: Fix ceph log location
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-29 13:37:44.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/ceph/templates/ceph-osd.json.j2', 'ansible/roles/ceph/templates/ceph.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/ceph/templates/ceph-rgw.json.j2', 'ansible/roles/ceph/templates/ceph-mon.json.j2'], 'message': 'Fix ceph log location

There are to parameter for ceph-mon/ceph-osd/radosgw, "-f" and "-d".

    -d run in foreground, log to stderr.
    -f run in foreground, log to usual location.

When log tin stderr, docker engine will collect the logs. It is useless
and we should write the log into file only. Then stop writing log to
stderr.

ceph-mon log location is controlled by "mon cluster log file".

Change-Id: I7883a4316420bc2bf4c772cb7248b663359f54b7
Closes-Bug: #1677237
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ceph log location

There are to parameter for ceph-mon/ceph-osd/radosgw, "-f" and "-d".

    -d run in foreground, log to stderr.
    -f run in foreground, log to usual location.

When log tin stderr, docker engine will collect the logs. It is useless
and we should write the log into file only. Then stop writing log to
stderr.

ceph-mon log location is controlled by "mon cluster log file".

Change-Id: I7883a4316420bc2bf4c772cb7248b663359f54b7
Closes-Bug: #1677237

commit_message:
Call clean_up_instance() during node teardown for Agent deploy

Agent based deploy do not call boot.clean_up_instance() during node
teardown. This is required so that instance clean up can happen as
part of node teardown.

Change-Id: I6077b69f17ce462b6aae1b16fdb40158cf111c5e
Closes-Bug: #1676321

subject: Fix OvnBaseConnection.get_schema_helper bug in some case
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-30 02:36:49.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/ovsdb/test_ovsdb_monitor.py'], 'message': "Fix OvnBaseConnection.get_schema_helper bug in some case

When thread of ovn ovsdb-server is not present(e.g. kill the process),
restart neutron-server and then start ovn ovsdb-server, neutron-server
can no longer connect to ovn ovsdb unless I delete ovs manager manually.
This bug is not always exists, it's caused by some recent neutron
modification. Neutron code moved Connection.get_schema_helper() logic
to idlutils.get_schema_helper()[1], the change affects OvnBaseConnection.
get_schema_helper(), because enable_connection_uri() is called again.
Use idlutils._get_schema_helper() instead of idlutils.get_schema_helper()
to fix this bug.
[1]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/agent/ovsdb/native/connection.py#L123-L129

Change-Id: I01a3a65f264bd7e080f9aa2c5e2482dbe07694f4
Partial-Bug: #1674889
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix OvnBaseConnection.get_schema_helper bug in some case

When thread of ovn ovsdb-server is not present(e.g. kill the process),
restart neutron-server and then start ovn ovsdb-server, neutron-server
can no longer connect to ovn ovsdb unless I delete ovs manager manually.
This bug is not always exists, it's caused by some recent neutron
modification. Neutron code moved Connection.get_schema_helper() logic
to idlutils.get_schema_helper()[1], the change affects OvnBaseConnection.
get_schema_helper(), because enable_connection_uri() is called again.
Use idlutils._get_schema_helper() instead of idlutils.get_schema_helper()
to fix this bug.
[1]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/agent/ovsdb/native/connection.py#L123-L129

Change-Id: I01a3a65f264bd7e080f9aa2c5e2482dbe07694f4
Partial-Bug: #1674889
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

subject: Implement disassociate_floatingips in l3_ovn.py
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-31 03:25:05.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/tests/functional/test_ovn_db_sync.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/l3/l3_ovn.py'], 'message': "Implement disassociate_floatingips in l3_ovn.py

When VM with floating IP associated was deleted, dnat_and_snat row in
OVN_Northbound DB was not removed. Then delete this floating IP,
dnat_and_snat is still in OVN DB.
Currently a workaround in _update_floating_ip_in_ovn is, when
re-associating, getting the list of nat rules and checking if the
external_ip with type 'dnat_and_snat' already exists or not. If exists,
set the new value.
However, disassociate_floatingips is the conventional approach for
l3 plugin to handle the callback of VM port' deleting, this patch
implements the function in l3_ovn plugin.

Change-Id: Ib487c00905d08e1f47f77bd4ddb2810c8ee19ea9
Closes-Bug: #1677581
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Implement disassociate_floatingips in l3_ovn.py

When VM with floating IP associated was deleted, dnat_and_snat row in
OVN_Northbound DB was not removed. Then delete this floating IP,
dnat_and_snat is still in OVN DB.
Currently a workaround in _update_floating_ip_in_ovn is, when
re-associating, getting the list of nat rules and checking if the
external_ip with type 'dnat_and_snat' already exists or not. If exists,
set the new value.
However, disassociate_floatingips is the conventional approach for
l3 plugin to handle the callback of VM port' deleting, this patch
implements the function in l3_ovn plugin.

Change-Id: Ib487c00905d08e1f47f77bd4ddb2810c8ee19ea9
Closes-Bug: #1677581
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

subject: Allow the split of install and config
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-03 14:05:09.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/keystone_db_setup.yml', 'tasks/keystone_install.yml'], 'message': 'Allow the split of install and config

If keystone install is done separately from the config (filtering
or interruption), a re-run of the role will not mark the venv
as changed, and the db sync will not trigger.

Here we force a flush on file next to the venv change, and use
this file (local fact) as a way to know if a db sync is required.

When a dbsync is considered done, i.e after the expand and migrate
stages, we mark the db_migrate as done for all the nodes.

Change-Id: I318700582a65cc1ea6571d9460fd58bed949a4e9
Depends-On: Ie4a47e85bf31e1ac3a2bd6f0dec510bb24abdbbd
'}]
commit_message:
Allow the split of install and config

If keystone install is done separately from the config (filtering
or interruption), a re-run of the role will not mark the venv
as changed, and the db sync will not trigger.

Here we force a flush on file next to the venv change, and use
this file (local fact) as a way to know if a db sync is required.

When a dbsync is considered done, i.e after the expand and migrate
stages, we mark the db_migrate as done for all the nodes.

Change-Id: I318700582a65cc1ea6571d9460fd58bed949a4e9
Depends-On: Ie4a47e85bf31e1ac3a2bd6f0dec510bb24abdbbd

subject: WIP Add ability to pass execute() to get_schema_helper
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-03 16:27:00.000000000', 'files': ['ovsdbapp/native/idlutils.py'], 'message': 'WIP Add ability to pass execute() to get_schema_helper

Since get_schema_helper() eventually calls enable_connection_uri,
we need to be able to pass an execute function that can handle
things like rootwrap, etc. if this is to be used. Of course, this
is deprecated in favor of passing a factory function that does all
of this outside the library so this might not be the right way to
go.

Change-Id: I626e94f95dcf858c65163e31005d5e047f133aa6
'}]
commit_message:
WIP Add ability to pass execute() to get_schema_helper

Since get_schema_helper() eventually calls enable_connection_uri,
we need to be able to pass an execute function that can handle
things like rootwrap, etc. if this is to be used. Of course, this
is deprecated in favor of passing a factory function that does all
of this outside the library so this might not be the right way to
go.

Change-Id: I626e94f95dcf858c65163e31005d5e047f133aa6

commit_message:
Revert "Uninstall postfix on nodes if it's there"

This reverts commit 2b017bc5b2f2f422e8b351a84d26bec31f6d7c16.

Postfix is needed by redhat-lsb-core so this breaks centos images.

Change-Id: I9eaceefb6bd327df5d78066106ba88fe1c44c778

subject: Correction in data db test cases
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-31 18:48:58.000000000', 'files': ['networking_odl/tests/unit/db/test_sqlite.py'], 'message': 'Correction in data db test cases

As per sql documents, timestamp is a string but in test cases we
are passing datetime object, which is causing failure of test,
with currnet version of sqlalchemy.

Before passing the object to query, it has been converted to
string.

Change-Id: I4d7ee2847e8df5b7ecf284ad1de8660ef1245b72
Closes-Bug: #1678280
'}]
commit_message:
Correction in data db test cases

As per sql documents, timestamp is a string but in test cases we
are passing datetime object, which is causing failure of test,
with currnet version of sqlalchemy.

Before passing the object to query, it has been converted to
string.

Change-Id: I4d7ee2847e8df5b7ecf284ad1de8660ef1245b72
Closes-Bug: #1678280

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-30 02:08:26.000000000', 'files': ['tests/functional/test_mysql_kafka_offsets.py'], 'message': 'Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids.

commit_message:
Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids.
We should only use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

Fixes bug #1082248

Change-Id: I0dbd2c7e2a03f3932a963ea2196f32574d3a2306

In the Ocata release, trove added support for encrypting the rpc
communication between the guest instances and the control plane.
These settings allow the user to specify installation specific

Change-Id: Ie42d754d58e983a15b553ad8a399813c9a700344

commit_message:
Add RPC encryption key support

In the Ocata release, trove added support for encrypting the rpc
communication between the guest instances and the control plane.
These settings allow the user to specify installation specific
keys versus using the default keys.

Change-Id: Ie42d754d58e983a15b553ad8a399813c9a700344

subject: Introduce neutron flavor associate, disassociate to OSC
revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2017-04-03 17:02:06.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/command-objects/network-flavor.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/neutron-client-flavors-81387171f67a3c82.yaml', 'openstackclient/tests/functional/network/v2/test_network_flavor.py', 'openstackclient/tests/unit/network/v2/test_network_flavor.py', 'setup.cfg', 'openstackclient/network/v2/network_flavor.py'], 'message': 'Introduce neutron flavor associate, disassociate to OSC

This patch introduces network flavor associate and disassociate to
OSC. The following neutron equivalent commands are implemented in OSC:

    - neutron flavor-associate
    - neutron flavor-disassociate

Change-Id: Icba4dbf7300a36353142586359059cd6784049dc
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce neutron flavor associate, disassociate to OSC

This patch introduces network flavor associate and disassociate to
OSC. The following neutron equivalent commands are implemented in OSC:

    - neutron flavor-associate
    - neutron flavor-disassociate

Change-Id: Icba4dbf7300a36353142586359059cd6784049dc

The Nova API doesn't support the extension anymore. The API
unittest shouldn't disable any part of Nova API. This patch
removes the tests which disable part of API in availability
zone unittests.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: Ifed7d8caa4c4abd79c74d95ff04583eb9f6fd54f

commit_message:
Remove the usage of extension black/white list opt in AZ

The Nova API doesn't support the extension anymore. The API
unittest shouldn't disable any part of Nova API. This patch
removes the tests which disable part of API in availability
zone unittests.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: Ifed7d8caa4c4abd79c74d95ff04583eb9f6fd54f

commit_message:
Introduce LineWithFocusChart

This commit introduces the NVD3 LineWithFocusChart to the homepage. This
chart might be useful for condensed charts like the o-h. Because users
can zoom in and out charts easily.

Change-Id: I5afde5bc0c6863e245b333cc8032b48170d69204

subject: Add Identity v3 API varibales to the designate example section.
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-03-31 17:29:43.000000000', 'files': ['doc/networking-guide/source/config-dns-int.rst'], 'message': 'Add Identity v3 API varibales to the designate example section.

The example provided for the designate section in neutron.conf is missing
keystone v3 parameters. If the OpenStack deployment is using keystone
v3 API then the current set of variables as shown in the example will
not be enough and neutron-server will complain about the missing keystone
variables.

commit_message:
Add Identity v3 API varibales to the designate example section.

The example provided for the designate section in neutron.conf is missing
keystone v3 parameters. If the OpenStack deployment is using keystone
v3 API then the current set of variables as shown in the example will
not be enough and neutron-server will complain about the missing keystone
variables.

Change-Id: Ic9a386f50812f89903f9b35fdfddb6e9850583fd

subject: Fix regex for gate-puppet-openstack-integration-4..
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 20:01:16.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Fix regex for gate-puppet-openstack-integration-4..

The commit Ic6a7728d6789c37bb57ceea51b295050cd40d242 was wrong on its
regex, because '|' exists between 'puppet-' and 'tripleo-ci' but the
patch did put 2 parts of the job name into the separated regex.
This patch fixes the regex.

NOTE: This regex seems long and redundant, but it would be easy to
      understand what jobs are mactched to this regex. So it would
      be useful for long-term maintenance.

Change-Id: I51ab5380b75ce57bfdf473988be5080c7d9edb8d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix regex for gate-puppet-openstack-integration-4..

The commit Ic6a7728d6789c37bb57ceea51b295050cd40d242 was wrong on its
regex, because '|' exists between 'puppet-' and 'tripleo-ci' but the
patch did put 2 parts of the job name into the separated regex.
This patch fixes the regex.

NOTE: This regex seems long and redundant, but it would be easy to
      understand what jobs are mactched to this regex. So it would
      be useful for long-term maintenance.

Change-Id: I51ab5380b75ce57bfdf473988be5080c7d9edb8d

subject: Ensure update of the container by object-updater
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-12 14:11:15.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/updater.py', 'test/probe/test_object_async_update.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_updater.py'], 'message': 'Ensure update of the container by object-updater

Object-updater regards 404 from container-server as success.
This causes wrong giving up and generates object which never appears
at container, for example when all container replicas are placed in
handoff devices at the moment.

This patch makes object-updater try updating until it gets 201s from
all container servers, and ensures the update.

Change-Id: Ic5d55ff368cec62ab2eb9fd883801ba4ab043dd4
Closes-Bug: #1328735
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure update of the container by object-updater

Object-updater regards 404 from container-server as success.
This causes wrong giving up and generates object which never appears
at container, for example when all container replicas are placed in
handoff devices at the moment.

This patch makes object-updater try updating until it gets 201s from
all container servers, and ensures the update.

Change-Id: Ic5d55ff368cec62ab2eb9fd883801ba4ab043dd4
Closes-Bug: #1328735

subject: Fix timing test error when rebalancing
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-23 02:30:47.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/cli/test_ringbuilder.py'], 'message': 'Fix timing test error when rebalancing

The reported timing can be 00:59:59 sometimes, but is still valid. This
will fail in the tests, as seen in [1].

This patch fixes this by mocking the current time, ensuring that the
first two rebalances happen at the same time.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/603845/

Change-Id: I0fd43d5bb13d0e88126f4f6ba14fb87faab6df9c
(cherry picked from commit 67d545e90f8046e686d3877c245b123c8b5fa58b)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix timing test error when rebalancing

The reported timing can be 00:59:59 sometimes, but is still valid. This
will fail in the tests, as seen in [1].

This patch fixes this by mocking the current time, ensuring that the
first two rebalances happen at the same time.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/603845/

Change-Id: I0fd43d5bb13d0e88126f4f6ba14fb87faab6df9c
(cherry picked from commit 67d545e90f8046e686d3877c245b123c8b5fa58b)

commit_message:
Generate/inject instack.json if overcloud nodes

Put generate/inject instack.json under the when
overcloud_nodes clause. It can not be used
independent from that and fails if there are no
overcloud nodes defined, f.e. the containerized
undercloud use case.

Change-Id: I32b42550b9b91ed1a1b0b53ef68920938232e75b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/11/442111/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-networking-sfc-ubuntu-xenial/0d87aca/console.html#_2017-03-07_20_40_34_903985

commit_message:
Fix tempest gate on stable/newton

This is a combination of 3 commits.

The first commit's message is:

Drop localrc references

devstack-gate supports local.conf over localrc now:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/326585/

This broke our tempest check, so dropping the only element filling
localrc file (sourcing devstackgaterc is needed all the time anyway to
get the DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX variable)

Change-Id: I9ee5e18cc5c879de500517e9c663ce99d01218d6
Closes-Bug: 1667485
(cherry picked from commit f081f642525b6027f1cad114d3d835bfd507e7dc)

This is the 2nd commit message:

Be explicit about the extensions being tested

Otherwise there the danger of skipping those important for SFC [1]

Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>
Original-Commit: Ibd0f67f9131e7f67f3a4a62cb6ad28bf80e11bbf

Needed-By: Ie995f6875a1e2b4c1e47a6596d7e84d9d72c768b
[1] http://logs.openstack.org/11/442111/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-networking-sfc-ubuntu-xenial/0d87aca/console.html#_2017-03-07_20_40_34_903985

Change-Id: I4a51e25b7fc3c39beea69433e3230838ae2f65bc
(cherry picked from commit 5cb1e424c9c38bfd75dd2f086ca6e21ee111ec42)

This is the 3rd commit message:

Add all extensions to the tempest run

The post hook runs full tempest as well.

Change-Id: I19e4df1b26b05f08d0d770e2cbfebff6e7e91270
(cherry picked from commit 2a4a9e1e985821129b91352631b7c5037af28bc0)

commit_message:
Fix novaclient creation for ocata and later.

novaclient.client.Client's positional args changed in 7.0.0 (ocata),
breaking this charm. This commit changes the client to use
keystoneauth1 based session authentication to work around that issue.

Change-Id: I1f8a2c872850daf2f5796d0c9f6f7d52e4c075e6
Closes-bug: #1671619

commit_message:
Add novalink apt key and repo before installation

The novalink apt key and repo were not being added until after the
pvm-novalink apt installation. This moves those steps to a new playbook
that will run before the apt installation when using the powervm driver
type.

Change-Id: I13588aecd7e3dfe31502956846a75fafd96d1afd
Closes-Bug: #1675913

commit_message:
Add redirect for shade docs

As part of the governance move, shade started publishing its docs at
docs.o.o/developer/shade instead of docs.o.o/infra/shade. Add a redirect
in case anyone has a link to the old location so that they don't get
stale content.

Change-Id: I7d62bd877d4f29dd496daff0db0aae58d439a054

commit_message:
Drop py34 target in setup.cfg

1.What is the problem?
We support py35 now, so it's no need to keep the supoort for
py34. Please see [1].

2.What is the solution to the problem?
Remove support for py34 in setup.cfg.

3.What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
None

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/349069/

Change-Id: I1bf4280b0ecd040847e5f68f711f611db342843f

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-03-30 15:37:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/tempest/api/test_qos.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Retrieve fresh network DB data before getting it in ml2

The DB objects that have join relationship with network, will be
acquired once during a DB transaction.
However, if they are updated after the first acquisition, the network
DB model object maintains the older value, and doesnt update it.

After cd7d63bde92e47a4b7bd4212b2e6c45f08c03143, the updated network
is retrieved from the db causing this bug.
This patch retrieves the latest data for these DB objects so that
updated information can be used.

Change-Id: Ic8935008515bed687ad3abd00c8ccaf656a30452
Closes-Bug: #1649503
'}]
commit_message:
Retrieve fresh network DB data before getting it in ml2

The DB objects that have join relationship with network, will be
acquired once during a DB transaction.
However, if they are updated after the first acquisition, the network
DB model object maintains the older value, and doesnt update it.

After cd7d63bde92e47a4b7bd4212b2e6c45f08c03143, the updated network
is retrieved from the db causing this bug.
This patch retrieves the latest data for these DB objects so that
updated information can be used.

Change-Id: Ic8935008515bed687ad3abd00c8ccaf656a30452
Closes-Bug: #1649503

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-16 10:43:37.000000000', 'files': ['docker/kolla-toolbox/kolla_keystone_service.py'], 'message': 'Add None value to service.description attribute

When using kolla_keystone_service module, if
description attribute is not created(example Keystone).
Service update will fail due missing attribute.

This change adds a None value to description in order to
allow service update when description was not added.

Change-Id: I568db4559428525ac6c5083cfc20cffc20be6342
'}]
commit_message:
Add None value to service.description attribute

When using kolla_keystone_service module, if
description attribute is not created(example Keystone).
Service update will fail due missing attribute.

This change adds a None value to description in order to
allow service update when description was not added.

Change-Id: I568db4559428525ac6c5083cfc20cffc20be6342

subject: Fix novaclient creation for ocata and later.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-03 22:20:59.000000000', 'files': ['src/templates/tempest.conf'], 'message': "Fix novaclient creation for ocata and later.

novaclient.client.Client's positional args changed in 7.0.0 (ocata),
breaking this charm. This commit changes the client to use keystoneauth1
based session authentication to work around that issue.

Closes: 1671619

Change-Id: I1d84f38583072d182720a1b24b15a56d83c9b40d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix novaclient creation for ocata and later.

novaclient.client.Client's positional args changed in 7.0.0 (ocata),
breaking this charm. This commit changes the client to use keystoneauth1
based session authentication to work around that issue.

Closes: 1671619

Change-Id: I1d84f38583072d182720a1b24b15a56d83c9b40d

subject: Set default domain for all keystone users
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-24 14:22:40.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp', 'elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': "Set default domain for all keystone users

The resource Keystone::Resource::Service_identity gets a parameter
called default_domain. This parameter comes into effect if no user or
project domain have been specified. So it's a good way to get all the
kesytone services to use this domain. The aforementioned resource is in
charge of creating the relevant keystone users, roles, services and
endpoints for OpenStack services.

Change-Id: Ic2e6fe9503a0af5fd652a5cbf25262bd705e3951
"}]
commit_message:
Set default domain for all keystone users

The resource Keystone::Resource::Service_identity gets a parameter
called default_domain. This parameter comes into effect if no user or
project domain have been specified. So it's a good way to get all the
kesytone services to use this domain. The aforementioned resource is in
charge of creating the relevant keystone users, roles, services and
endpoints for OpenStack services.

Change-Id: Ic2e6fe9503a0af5fd652a5cbf25262bd705e3951

calls instead to make it uniform.

commit_message:
[WIP] [Docs] Handle RHEL 7 STIG renumbering

This patch gets the docs adjusted to work with the new RHEL 7 STIG
version 1 release. The new STIG release has changed all of the
numbering, but it maintains a link to (most) of the old STIG IDs in
the XML.

Related-bug: 1676865
Change-Id: I1f0dcd0fe99a54bf5a92994de583225b1fdb8558

commit_message:
Log the correct request type of a subrequest downstream of copy

Before this change, subrequests made while servicing a copy would
result in logging the request type from the copy PUT/GET request
instead of the type from the subrequest being logged.

In order to have the correct requst type logged for subrequests:
- Changed subrequest environments to not inherit the orig_req_method
  of the enclosing request.
- Changed copy to be more picky about when it sets orig_req_method

In addition, subrequest environments will no longer inherit the
swift.log_info from the enclosing request.  That inheritance had
been added at Ic96a92e938589a2f6add35a40741fd062f1c29eb
along with swift.orig_req_method.

Change-Id: I1ccb2665b6cd2887659e548e55a26aa00de879e3
Closes-Bug: #1657246

subject: Correctly send 412 Precondition Failed in copy middleware
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-24 22:50:01.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/test_quotas.py', 'swift/common/middleware/copy.py', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_copy.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_account_quotas.py'], 'message': 'Correctly send 412 Precondition Failed in copy middleware

Previously in copy middleware, if a user entered an invalid destination
path with an invalid `container/object` path the server would return
a 500 Internal Server Error. However, the correct response should be
a 412 Precondition Failed. This patch updates copy so that it catches
the 412 Precondition Failed exception and returns it to the client.

Closes-Bug: #1641980

Change-Id: Ic4677ae033d05b8730c6ad1041bd9c07268e11a9
'}]
commit_message:
Correctly send 412 Precondition Failed in copy middleware

Previously in copy middleware, if a user entered an invalid destination
path with an invalid `container/object` path the server would return
a 500 Internal Server Error. However, the correct response should be
a 412 Precondition Failed. This patch updates copy so that it catches
the 412 Precondition Failed exception and returns it to the client.

Closes-Bug: #1641980

Change-Id: Ic4677ae033d05b8730c6ad1041bd9c07268e11a9

commit_message:
Log the correct request type of a subrequest downstream of copy

Before this change, subrequests made while servicing a copy would
result in logging the request type from the copy PUT/GET request
instead of the type from the subrequest being logged.

In order to have the correct requst type logged for subrequests:
- Changed subrequest environments to not inherit the orig_req_method
  of the enclosing request.
- Changed copy to be more picky about when it sets orig_req_method

In addition, subrequest environments will no longer inherit the
swift.log_info from the enclosing request.  That inheritance had
been added at Ic96a92e938589a2f6add35a40741fd062f1c29eb
along with swift.orig_req_method.

Change-Id: I1ccb2665b6cd2887659e548e55a26aa00de879e3
Closes-Bug: #1657246

commit_message:
Check rabbitmq user at step >= 2

The rabbitmq user check is moved to step >= 2 from step >= 1. There is
no gaurantee that rabbitmq is running at step 1, especially if updating
a failed stack that never made it past step 1 to begin with.

Change-Id: I029193da4c180deff3ab516bc8dc2da14c279317
Closes-Bug: #1675194
(cherry picked from commit aa9af086f05e466e88ac2a85ecc9d39f5a6d1e2f)

subject: Add support to changing the Rabbitmq password on update
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-31 05:10:08.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/rabbitmq_password_change-4fce15c9ebb0e20c.yaml', 'manifests/profile/base/rabbitmq.pp'], 'message': "Add support to changing the Rabbitmq password on update

Rabbitmq Password is set on the fresh deployment, but during
update, if the password is changed, it is modified in all config
files including rabbitmq config. But the rabbitmq connection fails
because the new password is not successful applied to rabbitmq.
Setting the rabbitmq_user will invoke 'rabbitmqctl change_password'.

Scenario: The password change is applied on Step1 when configuring
Rabbitmq. Other services may be updated on different Steps. Till
other services config is updated with new rabbitmq password, and
restarted, the connections will get Access Denied response. It has
cyclic dependency. So the passwords will be changes at Step1 and
once all services are updated, the connections will work as is.

Partial-Bug: #1611704
Change-Id: I44865af3d5eb2d37eb648ac7227277e86c8fbc54
(cherry picked from commit 76931e535c69ab437c4710dc749bc363f4533ea5)
"}]
commit_message:
Add support to changing the Rabbitmq password on update

Rabbitmq Password is set on the fresh deployment, but during
update, if the password is changed, it is modified in all config
files including rabbitmq config. But the rabbitmq connection fails
because the new password is not successful applied to rabbitmq.
Setting the rabbitmq_user will invoke 'rabbitmqctl change_password'.

Scenario: The password change is applied on Step1 when configuring
Rabbitmq. Other services may be updated on different Steps. Till
other services config is updated with new rabbitmq password, and
restarted, the connections will get Access Denied response. It has
cyclic dependency. So the passwords will be changes at Step1 and
once all services are updated, the connections will work as is.

Partial-Bug: #1611704
Change-Id: I44865af3d5eb2d37eb648ac7227277e86c8fbc54
(cherry picked from commit 76931e535c69ab437c4710dc749bc363f4533ea5)

subject: Change noauth strategy for plugin loading
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-28 00:58:54.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/shell.py'], 'message': "Change noauth strategy for plugin loading

Don't do it.

os-client-config's plugin loading has been causing this pain for a long
time, removing the KSC hack-around in o-c-c unmasked this again.  So when
auth is not reuired, just don't let o-c-c do any plugin loading at all.

Ever.

Of course, this shouldn't be in OSC either, but we have to do this until
the equivalent fix lands in osc-lib, is released and makes it into the
global requirements minimum version.

Depends-on: Ie68c82f7b073012685f0513b615ab1bf00bc0c3a
Change-Id: Ifdf65f3bb90fb923947a2cbe80a881d71a3fee56
"}]
commit_message:
Change noauth strategy for plugin loading

Don't do it.

os-client-config's plugin loading has been causing this pain for a long
time, removing the KSC hack-around in o-c-c unmasked this again.  So when
auth is not reuired, just don't let o-c-c do any plugin loading at all.

Ever.

Of course, this shouldn't be in OSC either, but we have to do this until
the equivalent fix lands in osc-lib, is released and makes it into the
global requirements minimum version.

Depends-on: Ie68c82f7b073012685f0513b615ab1bf00bc0c3a
Change-Id: Ifdf65f3bb90fb923947a2cbe80a881d71a3fee56

commit_message:
Move horizon to step 3

We configure apache in step 3 so horizon should be configured at the
same time or else updates will cause horizon to be unvailable during the
update process.

Change-Id: I4032f7c24edc0ff9ed637e213870cdd3beb9a54e
Closes-Bug: #1678338
(cherry picked from commit e2928717412242faa4eb15d778f1b5c0952edc08)

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-04-03 16:43:23.000000000', 'files': ['constraints.txt', 'devstack/pre_test_hook.sh', 'tools/tox_install.sh', 'devstack/settings.odl', 'tools/tox_install_project.sh', 'devstack/odl-releases/beryllium-snapshot-0.4.5', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "test-requirement: avoid sqlalchemy 1.1.5+

This patch is one that two patches are squashed into in
order to unbreak CI.

From sqlalchemy 1.1.5, with_variant doesn't work as expected
https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/issues/3952/
Keep it's version under 1.1.4 until its fix
Once sqlalchemy 1.1.9 is released and requirements/upper-constraints.txt
is updated, revert this patch.

Ansn remove the definition for 0.4.5-snapshot.
As berylium 0.4.5 snapshot was deleted from ODL nexus,
This patch also adjusts related script.

Change-Id: I2dd8f30982d9deb7e24eae386e8387b1eda97448
"}]
commit_message:
test-requirement: avoid sqlalchemy 1.1.5+

This patch is one that two patches are squashed into in
order to unbreak CI.

From sqlalchemy 1.1.5, with_variant doesn't work as expected
https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/issues/3952/
Keep it's version under 1.1.4 until its fix
Once sqlalchemy 1.1.9 is released and requirements/upper-constraints.txt
is updated, revert this patch.

Ansn remove the definition for 0.4.5-snapshot.
As berylium 0.4.5 snapshot was deleted from ODL nexus,
This patch also adjusts related script.

Change-Id: I2dd8f30982d9deb7e24eae386e8387b1eda97448

subject: Update post_test_hook to use multinode environment.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-03 15:00:30.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/post_test_hook.sh'], 'message': 'Update post_test_hook to use multinode environment.

Now that a new infra job has been added to Patrole for a
multinode environment [0], the post_test_hook in Patrole
needs to be updated.

This change will still keep "fast" tests in the "fast" gates,
although they have been renamed to not have the "fast" substring;
and it will still keep "slow" tests in the "slow" gates,
although they have been renamed with "multinode" instead of "slow".

This means that tests that require multiple nodes, like migrating
a server, can be run, rather than skipped.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/450278/

Change-Id: I278695026ce273daa8cb44e9c472cf84e880a618
'}]
commit_message:
Update post_test_hook to use multinode environment.

Now that a new infra job has been added to Patrole for a
multinode environment [0], the post_test_hook in Patrole
needs to be updated.

This change will still keep "fast" tests in the "fast" gates,
although they have been renamed to not have the "fast" substring;
and it will still keep "slow" tests in the "slow" gates,
although they have been renamed with "multinode" instead of "slow".

This means that tests that require multiple nodes, like migrating
a server, can be run, rather than skipped.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/450278/

Change-Id: I278695026ce273daa8cb44e9c472cf84e880a618

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-24 06:29:15.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/aws/autoscaling/autoscaling_group.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/scaling_policy.py', 'heat/tests/autoscaling/test_heat_scaling_policy.py'], 'message': "To reset metadata for resources when mark healthy

We reset the metadata for resources when mark healthy
in change Ibd6c18acf6f3f24cf9bf16a524127850968062bc,
but it doesn't work, because resource policy and group
inherit from multiple class, and the method
'handle_metadata_reset' actually be called now is wrong.

This patch will fix it.

Change-Id: I8583f26b6c8f6c814a00a0a38042484378fa53db
Closes-Bug: #1672596
(cherry picked from commit ebc210375eefdb06f165e85d0cea3c02b86b29ab)

commit_message:
To reset metadata for resources when mark healthy

We reset the metadata for resources when mark healthy
in change Ibd6c18acf6f3f24cf9bf16a524127850968062bc,
but it doesn't work, because resource policy and group
inherit from multiple class, and the method
'handle_metadata_reset' actually be called now is wrong.

This patch will fix it.

Change-Id: I8583f26b6c8f6c814a00a0a38042484378fa53db
Closes-Bug: #1672596
(cherry picked from commit ebc210375eefdb06f165e85d0cea3c02b86b29ab)

commit_message:
test_basic_instance: validate fixed IP before floating IP

Otherwise connectivity check failure doesn't give a clue if it's a
common connectivity issue (maybe even ssh keypair not delivered), or
it's indeed address translation related.

Change-Id: I549aa99fa46942d6fb2a671be656eb7641a64c49

commit_message:
[Multitenancy] Add ironic_provision_network checkbox

This patch adds ironic_provision_network checkbox to Openstack Services tab.
The checkbox is added if Ironic component is enabled.
It is a trigger to configure separate provision network for baremetal nodes.

Related-Bug: #1588380
Change-Id: I83aea95f84f18e01c29debd2f57a557496c437ad

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2017-04-03 12:01:13.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/ironic_inspector_spec.rb', 'manifests/conductor.pp', 'manifests/drivers/deploy.pp', 'manifests/inspector/authtoken.pp', 'manifests/init.pp', 'manifests/inspector.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/newton-deprecations-4a65e92bf2e1dedb.yaml', 'manifests/api/authtoken.pp', 'manifests/db/inspector_sync.pp', 'templates/inspector_dnsmasq_http.erb'], 'message': 'Clean up deprecated items supposed to be removed in Ocata and Pike

* Support for disabling UEFI in inspector
* Authtoken signing_dir argument
* ironic::drivers::deploy manifest
* ironic::db::inspector_sync manifest
* enabled_drivers and rabbit_user from init manifest

This change leaves out the following deprecation
* Implicit including of ironic::pxe in inspector (due to unclear CI problems)
* Other rabbit_* parameters (THT still uses them, sigh)

Change-Id: Ibf1c64bb5a6538610dfd9529526f203374b4e7da
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up deprecated items supposed to be removed in Ocata and Pike

* Support for disabling UEFI in inspector
* Authtoken signing_dir argument
* ironic::drivers::deploy manifest
* ironic::db::inspector_sync manifest
* enabled_drivers and rabbit_user from init manifest

This change leaves out the following deprecation
* Implicit including of ironic::pxe in inspector (due to unclear CI problems)
* Other rabbit_* parameters (THT still uses them, sigh)

Change-Id: Ibf1c64bb5a6538610dfd9529526f203374b4e7da

subject: Revert "Install requirements with pip update"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-03 16:49:35.000000000', 'files': ['quickstart.sh'], 'message': 'Revert "Install requirements with pip update"

This reverts commit 4dd7b70670d7c0c98b8dcd4aeb42252f9e49aaf2.

This patch is causing internal jobs that unpack a custom role to fail when quickstart is run the second time (which we do in CI).  Per discussion with Sagi posting a revert for this until we can figure out the right solution.

This is blocking all rdophase2 internal jobs.

Change-Id: I1e8809e0adebad8c731cc42b6b5dac6530970771
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Install requirements with pip update"

This reverts commit 4dd7b70670d7c0c98b8dcd4aeb42252f9e49aaf2.

This patch is causing internal jobs that unpack a custom role to fail when quickstart is run the second time (which we do in CI).  Per discussion with Sagi posting a revert for this until we can figure out the right solution.

This is blocking all rdophase2 internal jobs.

Change-Id: I1e8809e0adebad8c731cc42b6b5dac6530970771

commit_message:
Fix block-device-mapping when volume_size is empty

The Nova API responds with an validation error when a bdm is submitted
containing an empty volume_size. So instead omit that attribute when it
is empty.

Change-Id: Iba905fca8c440a03e828c20922f3b813bba3fa3a
Closes-Bug: 1677236

Partially-Implements: #1616642

Change-Id: I0e15ab70afd5bbbc8b94db0dc9e64f13146003e8
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce Octavia v2 API for Members

This patch aligns Octavia v2 API for members with
lbaasv2.

GET all - /v2.0/lbaas/pools/<pool-id>/members
GET one - /v2.0/lbaas/pools/<pool-id>/members/<member-id>
POST - /v2.0/lbaas/pools/<pool-id>/members {<body>}
PUT - /v2.0/lbaas/pools/<pool-id>/members/<member-id> {<body>}
DELETE - /v2.0/lbaas/pools/<pool-id>/members/<member-id>

Also fixes a few bugs from previous API commits and refactors
some test code / adds missing tests.

Note: This changes the default operating_status of Members from OFFLINE
to NO_MONITOR in the *v1* API, if the pool has no Health Monitor.
I see this as a bug fix.

Co-Authored-By: Nakul Dahiwade <nakul.dahiwade@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>

Partially-Implements: #1616642
Closes-Bug: #1678330
Closes-Bug: #1678336
Closes-Bug: #1678337
Change-Id: I0e15ab70afd5bbbc8b94db0dc9e64f13146003e8

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I24ca32d9e92cdd2b3a91916337839d116e335084
