Ocata updates

This changeset contains updates for Ocata.

Notable changes include:
- Placement API added
- cell database added
- Reduced RAM use (fewer processes per service)

Currently, inspection works automatically in all boot modes. However, deployment
requires UEFI to be explicitly enabled on nodes. This change enables
ironic-inspector to provide boot_mode capability based on actual boot mode.

Change-Id: I808eb5c0b92b0b84ad7fc2c49f94aa675fc64dde
Closes-Bug: #1675052
'}]
commit_message:
Enable boot mode detection by ironic-inspector

Currently, inspection works automatically in all boot modes. However, deployment
requires UEFI to be explicitly enabled on nodes. This change enables
ironic-inspector to provide boot_mode capability based on actual boot mode.

Note that proper UEFI support still requires flavor changes.

Change-Id: I808eb5c0b92b0b84ad7fc2c49f94aa675fc64dde
Closes-Bug: #1675052

commit_message:
Re-Add bigswitch agent support

The agent configuration was lost in newton during the puppet-tripleo and
THT role conversion. This change adds support for including the bigswitch
agent service for composable roles.

subject: Remove enabled_services=tempest from patrole gate jobs.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-03 17:24:41.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/patrole.yaml'], 'message': "Remove enabled_services=tempest from patrole gate jobs.

Currently, ENABLED_SERVICES=tempest is contained in the gate jobs
for patrole. This appears to be causing problem when setting
up the multinode devstack environment [0], because

  tempest verify-config

is executed, which fails because:

  AttributeError: 'Manager' object has no attribute 'image_client'

which probably happens because tempest isn't set up on the other nodes,
causing tempest verify-config to fail.

Other multinode setups do not contain ENABLED_SERVICES=tempest:
for example [1]. Regardless, tempest is added to ENABLED_SERVICES
automatically by a script, apparently after devstack is done [1].

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/68/452768/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-multinode-admin-ubuntu-xenial-nv/6401f12/logs/devstack-subnodes-early.txt.gz
[1] http://logs.openstack.org/41/452041/7/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-scenario-multinode-ubuntu-xenial-nv/5907cf4/logs/devstack-subnodes-early.txt.gz

Change-Id: I0d59d6b956ff50e18364775054e16be79c39d799
"}]
commit_message:
Remove enabled_services=tempest from patrole gate jobs.

Currently, ENABLED_SERVICES=tempest is contained in the gate jobs
for patrole. This appears to be causing problem when setting
up the multinode devstack environment [0], because

  tempest verify-config

is executed, which fails because:

  AttributeError: 'Manager' object has no attribute 'image_client'

which probably happens because tempest isn't set up on the other nodes,
causing tempest verify-config to fail.

Other multinode setups do not contain ENABLED_SERVICES=tempest:
for example [1]. Regardless, tempest is added to ENABLED_SERVICES
automatically by a script, apparently after devstack is done [1].

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/68/452768/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-multinode-admin-ubuntu-xenial-nv/6401f12/logs/devstack-subnodes-early.txt.gz
[1] http://logs.openstack.org/41/452041/7/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-scenario-multinode-ubuntu-xenial-nv/5907cf4/logs/devstack-subnodes-early.txt.gz

Change-Id: I0d59d6b956ff50e18364775054e16be79c39d799

When collecting logs from containers we leave symlinks in out
logs directory which are failed to copy by zuul and it fails
infras logs collecting completely.

commit_message:
Remove ipxe dir before download

This commit adds the removal of the /tmp/ipxe directory before
downloading the upstream sources via git.
This will make this script idempotent, otherwise if the directory is
present git command will fail with the entire quickstart command.

Change-Id: Ic2e690f892300d7b17daa256242e2b59424d68f2

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-28 11:47:32.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_db_api.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "[BugFix]Cinder forgets to update 'deleted_at' when deleting

Usually we would update the 'deleted_at' column when
soft-deleting records, otherwise the 'db purge' command
would fail because it depends on the 'deleted_at' column.

Close-Bug: #1671354

Change-Id: Ib302488d3a007df09a2e7ece40488c00bf732119
"}]
commit_message:
[BugFix]Cinder forgets to update 'deleted_at' when deleting

Usually we would update the 'deleted_at' column when
soft-deleting records, otherwise the 'db purge' command
would fail because it depends on the 'deleted_at' column.

Close-Bug: #1671354

Change-Id: Ib302488d3a007df09a2e7ece40488c00bf732119

If the failure host is selected as reserved_host,
evacuation to the failure host will be executed.
This patch added processing to change the 'reserved' column
of hosts to False so that the failure host will not be selected
as reserved_host.

Change-Id: I6e5f1087baf64787d759ed7c5b318d4a14aecb4c
Closes-Bug: #1670940

commit_message:
Delete the failure host from reserved_host

If the failure host is selected as reserved_host,
evacuation to the failure host will be executed.
This patch added processing to change the 'reserved' column
of hosts to False so that the failure host will not be selected
as reserved_host.

Change-Id: I6e5f1087baf64787d759ed7c5b318d4a14aecb4c
Closes-Bug: #1670940

commit_message:
Add "Save and Close" button to configuration modal dialog

Depending on your preferred workflow, you might want the dialog to close once
you've saved your changes.  To support both scenarios, this commit introduces a
new button in the same form which simply reads "Save and Close".  This way, the
user can choose what they'd like to happen once their changes are saved.

Closes-Bug: #1674789
(cherry picked from commit d238f308efc326eedcb26c4ce14e4db375145d43)

Change-Id: I84b1d603d34bde60f0edac7b2ce407f357426b23

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Disable N531 neutron-lib check (still present in current release)

Also fix a missing space in error message

Change-Id: I6fb627d081dc59fcf0a36d80a6e24f866665787c

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 15.1.1

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

subject: Fix token auth in ansible inventory script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-31 11:11:52.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo-ansible-inventory'], 'message': 'Fix token auth in ansible inventory script

The token authentication in the inventory script currently uses the
`user_domain_id` parameter, which is supposed to be used with password
authentication only.

This patch removed the param.

Change-Id: I5ec5aa386eb267283cc187cf1d4206827e6b3191
Closes-Bug: #1678029
'}]
commit_message:
Fix token auth in ansible inventory script

The token authentication in the inventory script currently uses the
`user_domain_id` parameter, which is supposed to be used with password
authentication only.

This patch removed the param.

Change-Id: I5ec5aa386eb267283cc187cf1d4206827e6b3191
Closes-Bug: #1678029

subject: Break user credentials from host at the rightmost '@'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-23 19:43:32.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/transport.py'], 'message': "Break user credentials from host at the rightmost '@'

The rightmost '@' in a url netloc field separates the user:password
from the hostname:port.  Using the first may cause the separation to
occur in the username or password field (if unencoded).

Change-Id: I7b02d8e0cbdf875ea80a55065ce98fa73696e05f
Closes-Bug: 1675423
"}]
commit_message:
Break user credentials from host at the rightmost '@'

The rightmost '@' in a url netloc field separates the user:password
from the hostname:port.  Using the first may cause the separation to
occur in the username or password field (if unencoded).

Change-Id: I7b02d8e0cbdf875ea80a55065ce98fa73696e05f
Closes-Bug: 1675423

commit_message:
Switch OVB to use promoted repos from trunk.rdoproject.org

CDN sync is broken:
https://bugs.centos.org/view.php?id=12994

Let's use the repo from rdoproject.org, less reliable but temporary
until CDN works.

We're also working on using mirrors from OpenStack Infra, so this patch
is temporary for a few days, it should be ok.

Change-Id: I3c2f8caeca41a6fa94eb22583868581f8378098a

revisions:
[{'number': 38, 'created': '2017-03-24 02:10:04.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/common/test_release_mappings.py', 'etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_rpcapi.py', 'ironic/common/release_mappings.py', 'ironic/conf/default.py', 'doc/source/dev/releasing.rst', 'ironic/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'ironic/conductor/rpcapi.py', 'ironic/objects/base.py'], 'message': 'Add RPC and object version pinning

To support rolling upgrades, capping of RPC communication and Ironic
objects is required. Old RPC services and objects may still be running
while an upgrade is in progress. This makes sure that these old
services are called and all objects are used in a supported RPC and
objects version.

This patch adds the configuration option "pin_release_version". Setting
this option caps (downgrades) the internal RPC communication to the
specified version to enable communication with older services. When
doing a rolling upgrade from version X to Y, set this to X. It defaults
to using the newest (current) possible RPC behavior and object versions.

Change-Id: Ie2342d4051f85392a8b10d39ebffc287da57bf2b
Partial-Bug: #1526283
Co-Authored-By: Szymon Borkowski <szymon.borkowski@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ruby Loo <ruby.loo@intel.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add RPC and object version pinning

To support rolling upgrades, capping of RPC communication and Ironic
objects is required. Old RPC services and objects may still be running
while an upgrade is in progress. This makes sure that these old
services are called and all objects are used in a supported RPC and
objects version.

This patch adds the configuration option "pin_release_version". Setting
this option caps (downgrades) the internal RPC communication to the
specified version to enable communication with older services. When
doing a rolling upgrade from version X to Y, set this to X. It defaults
to using the newest (current) possible RPC behavior and object versions.

Change-Id: Ie2342d4051f85392a8b10d39ebffc287da57bf2b
Partial-Bug: #1526283
Co-Authored-By: Szymon Borkowski <szymon.borkowski@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ruby Loo <ruby.loo@intel.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup plugin loaded_base

neutron_plugin_loaded_base is only used in the template. This
var probably shouldn't be used by any deployer, so we mask this
variable from the defaults.

Change-Id: I8d7903dbb9a6f7d096eb3f840164b87c48eb5e4d
(manual cherry picked from commit 6c2b61453320d81f9b459396157aaf68f2d38462)

commit_message:
Use correct region value

TripleO is using 'regionOne' instead of default 'RegionOne',
so we need to override the default in config file.

Closes-Bug: rhbz#1357579

(cherry picked from commit 5af714c0a8843511a9ea0a9d29febd14b0a39e0d)
Conflicts:
	tripleoclient/utils.py

Change-Id: I7c16bbed9b86ee3331aa9f7fea1a0cf6c80b9ca8

commit_message:
Separate RHEL from Ubuntu code and fix Ubuntu ceph default repo url.

The ceph repo for Ubunto was broken and pointed to
http://mirror.centos.org/centos/7/storage/x86_64/ceph-jewel/dists/xenial/main/binary-amd64/Packages
[1].

Furthermore epel activation/deactivation makes no sense on Ubuntu
platform.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/65/432165/19/check/gate-puppet-vswitch-puppet-beaker-rspec-ubuntu-xenial/daad266/console.html#_2017-04-03_05_13_45_306095

Closes-Bug: #1678932

Change-Id: I5d3c75b14145d3f55eec5f019b962cc4888404e5

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-04-03 09:42:58.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/fake_policy.py', 'mistral/api/controllers/v2/execution.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/api/v2/test_executions.py'], 'message': 'Role based resource access control - get executions

We already supported role based api access control, this series patches
will implement resource access control for mistral, so that
administrator could define the rules of resource accessibility, e.g.
admin user could get/delete/update the workflows of other tenants
according to the policy.

This patch supports admin user to query executions of other tenants.

Partially implements: blueprint mistral-rbac

Change-Id: I7a5de13d4a067456bb001640189e54a230f196ad
'}]
commit_message:
Role based resource access control - get executions

We already supported role based api access control, this series patches
will implement resource access control for mistral, so that
administrator could define the rules of resource accessibility, e.g.
admin user could get/delete/update the workflows of other tenants
according to the policy.

This patch supports admin user to query executions of other tenants.

Partially implements: blueprint mistral-rbac

Change-Id: I7a5de13d4a067456bb001640189e54a230f196ad

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-04-03 13:48:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/nfs.py'], 'message': 'NFS: Failed to create or delete snapshot

In the implementation of the creation or deletion snapshot, the function
will check whether the nfs snapshot function is enabled, but the function
check_snapshot_support there is a default parameter setup_checking, the
default value is False. In the function set_checking if the set_checking
value of setup_checking is False, it will fail to create or delete the
snapshot, even if the nfs configuration supports snapshots.

Change-Id: I7be88b1ea2149b6e0f320f250e707a677c75ec2b
Closes-Bug: #1675326
'}]
commit_message:
NFS: Failed to create or delete snapshot

In the implementation of the creation or deletion snapshot, the function
will check whether the nfs snapshot function is enabled, but the function
check_snapshot_support there is a default parameter setup_checking, the
default value is False. In the function set_checking if the set_checking
value of setup_checking is False, it will fail to create or delete the
snapshot, even if the nfs configuration supports snapshots.

Change-Id: I7be88b1ea2149b6e0f320f250e707a677c75ec2b
Closes-Bug: #1675326

We configure apache in step 3 so horizon should be configured at the
same time or else updates will cause horizon to be unvailable during the
update process.

commit_message:
Qpid dispatch router composable role

Note: since it replaces rabbitmq, in order to aim for the smallest
amount of changes the service_name is called 'rabbitmq' so all the
other services do not need additional logic to use qdr.

Depends-On: Idecbbabdd4f06a37ff0cfb34dc23732b1176a608
Change-Id: I27f01d2570fa32de91ffe1991dc873cdf2293dbc

subject: Increase libvirt/qemu.conf max_files and max_processes
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-04-03 09:36:46.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/nova-libvirt.yaml'], 'message': 'Increase libvirt/qemu.conf max_files and max_processes

When Nova and/or Cinder are using Ceph as backend, qemu will need to
open a connection and two threads for each and every Ceph OSD.

This change raises the max_files (set to 1024 by default) to 32768 and
the max_processes (set to 4096 by default) to 131072. The max number
of FDs is per-process, while the max number of processes is
per-user. The values can be overridden via ExtraConfig, no params are
added to the templates.

A more detailed description of the values were chosen can be found at:
https://access.redhat.com/solutions/1602683

Unclean cherry-pick from I1e79675f6aac1b0fe6cc7269550fa6bc8586e1fb

Change-Id: I1e79675f6aac1b0fe6cc7269550fa6bc8586e1fb
Depends-On: I258afd3ee6633e4b2ebc45aa8611be652476be0c
Closes-Bug: 1673995
'}]
commit_message:
Increase libvirt/qemu.conf max_files and max_processes

When Nova and/or Cinder are using Ceph as backend, qemu will need to
open a connection and two threads for each and every Ceph OSD.

This change raises the max_files (set to 1024 by default) to 32768 and
the max_processes (set to 4096 by default) to 131072. The max number
of FDs is per-process, while the max number of processes is
per-user. The values can be overridden via ExtraConfig, no params are
added to the templates.

A more detailed description of the values were chosen can be found at:
https://access.redhat.com/solutions/1602683

Unclean cherry-pick from I1e79675f6aac1b0fe6cc7269550fa6bc8586e1fb

Change-Id: I1e79675f6aac1b0fe6cc7269550fa6bc8586e1fb
Depends-On: I258afd3ee6633e4b2ebc45aa8611be652476be0c
Closes-Bug: 1673995

[{'number': 15, 'created': '2017-03-31 07:21:47.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/extensions/network_manager/serializers/neutron_serializers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_orchestrator_serializer_110.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_orchestrator_serializer_100.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/deployment_serializers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/statistics/fuel_statistics/installation_info.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/fixtures/openstack.yaml', 'nailgun/nailgun/consts.py'], 'message': "Add Ironic multitenancy support

This patch adds support to deploy Ironic with separate Neutron network
for provisioning baremetal instances.

  * Add NetworkDeploymentSerializer100 as Ironic multitenancy is supported
    from Newton, and we will backport this till stable/newton.
  * Update network scheme generation to create 'vlan' baremetal network,
    assign IPs to Ironic conductors from this network, make them
    accessible from baremetal servers.
  * Add new checkbox at 'Openstack Settings/Additional components' tab
    which allows to define if separate provisioning network should be used
    during deployment. This is a trigger to switch ironic deployment to
    multitenancy case. If not selected old behaviour is kept, 'flat'
    network is used. The checkbox is shown only when Ironic component is
    enabled.

Change-Id: I861a8b3b046202526d6a856c9f2dca2cfaddc887
Related-Bug: #1588380
"}]
commit_message:
Add Ironic multitenancy support

This patch adds support to deploy Ironic with separate Neutron network
for provisioning baremetal instances.

  * Add NetworkDeploymentSerializer100 as Ironic multitenancy is supported
    from Newton, and we will backport this till stable/newton.
  * Update network scheme generation to create 'vlan' baremetal network,
    assign IPs to Ironic conductors from this network, make them
    accessible from baremetal servers.
  * Add new checkbox at 'Openstack Settings/Additional components' tab
    which allows to define if separate provisioning network should be used
    during deployment. This is a trigger to switch ironic deployment to
    multitenancy case. If not selected old behaviour is kept, 'flat'
    network is used. The checkbox is shown only when Ironic component is
    enabled.

Change-Id: I861a8b3b046202526d6a856c9f2dca2cfaddc887
Related-Bug: #1588380

subject: Fix potential cluster setup race
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 20936, 'name': 'Raoul Scarazzini', 'email': 'rasca@mmul.it', 'username': 'rasca'}, {'_account_id': 21537, 'name': 'Yurii Prokulevych', 'email': 'yprokule@redhat.com', 'username': 'yprokule'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-04-03 08:50:33.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/corosync.pp'], 'message': 'Fix potential cluster setup race

It seems currently there is a small window for a race opportunity
when we set up the pacemaker cluster with puppet-pacemaker.
The operator will observe the following error:

Error: /Stage[main]/Pacemaker::Corosync/Exec[Start Cluster
tripleo_cluster]/returns: change from notrun to 0 failed:
/sbin/pcs cluster start --all returned 1 instead of one of 0

The following might happen:
On the bootstrap node (where setup_cluster is true) we call
Exec <|tag == 'pacemaker-auth'|> ->
exec {"Create Cluster ${cluster_name}":
  creates => '/etc/cluster/cluster.conf',
  command => "${::pacemaker::pcs_bin} cluster setup --name ${cluster_name} ${cluster_members_rrp_real} ${cluster_setup_extras_real}",
  unless => '/usr/bin/test -f /etc/corosync/corosync.conf',
  require => Class['::pacemaker::install'],
} -> exec {"Start Cluster ${cluster_name}":
  unless => "${::pacemaker::pcs_bin} status >/dev/null 2>&1",
  command => "${::pacemaker::pcs_bin} cluster start --all",
  require => Exec["Create Cluster ${cluster_name}"],
}

The problem with the above is that "pcs cluster setup"
internally will call pcsd.pcsd_sync_certs(...) which will restart pcsd
without waiting. So if we restart pcsd on all nodes and then
jump straift to "pcs cluster start --all" the pcs API call that
starts the cluster on the remote node might happen during the pcsd
restart and hence get a 400 BAD request:
I, [2017-03-29T07:25:00.943344 #15581] INFO -- : CIB USER: hacluster, groups:
Shutting down (TERM)Shutting down (TERM)
[2017-03-29 07:25:09] INFO going to shutdown ...
I, [2017-03-29T07:25:09.901537 #15581] INFO -- : Return Value:
::ffff:172.17.0.17 - - [29/Mar/2017:07:25:09 +0000] "GET /remote/cluster_start HTTP/1.1" 400 - 8.9617
[2017-03-29 07:25:09] INFO WEBrick::HTTPServer#start done.

We try to address this by doing two things:
A) We add a --wait switch to the cluster setup which should wait until
   the restart is complete.
B) We add a set of retries to the cluster start statement

While it is likely that either one of these be enough to close this
race, given the elusiveness of the problem (in CI upstream we hit
it twice in the last month), I prefer taking a more comprehensive
approach at closing this window.

Another option would have been to remove the cluster start exec
statement and simply add --start to the cluster setup call. This
approach seems to me like a smaller less invasive change. Since I'd like
to backport this issue to older releases as well, I prefer to not
change the setup code too much at this stage.

Change-Id: I7cdfcbced0031040e9f45ddba7389868bb3f59b2
Closes-Bug: #1677312
'}]
commit_message:
Fix potential cluster setup race

It seems currently there is a small window for a race opportunity
when we set up the pacemaker cluster with puppet-pacemaker.
The operator will observe the following error:

Error: /Stage[main]/Pacemaker::Corosync/Exec[Start Cluster
tripleo_cluster]/returns: change from notrun to 0 failed:
/sbin/pcs cluster start --all returned 1 instead of one of 0

The following might happen:
On the bootstrap node (where setup_cluster is true) we call
Exec <|tag == 'pacemaker-auth'|> ->
exec {"Create Cluster ${cluster_name}":
  creates => '/etc/cluster/cluster.conf',
  command => "${::pacemaker::pcs_bin} cluster setup --name ${cluster_name} ${cluster_members_rrp_real} ${cluster_setup_extras_real}",
  unless => '/usr/bin/test -f /etc/corosync/corosync.conf',
  require => Class['::pacemaker::install'],
} -> exec {"Start Cluster ${cluster_name}":
  unless => "${::pacemaker::pcs_bin} status >/dev/null 2>&1",
  command => "${::pacemaker::pcs_bin} cluster start --all",
  require => Exec["Create Cluster ${cluster_name}"],
}

The problem with the above is that "pcs cluster setup"
internally will call pcsd.pcsd_sync_certs(...) which will restart pcsd
without waiting. So if we restart pcsd on all nodes and then
jump straift to "pcs cluster start --all" the pcs API call that
starts the cluster on the remote node might happen during the pcsd
restart and hence get a 400 BAD request:
I, [2017-03-29T07:25:00.943344 #15581] INFO -- : CIB USER: hacluster, groups:
Shutting down (TERM)Shutting down (TERM)
[2017-03-29 07:25:09] INFO going to shutdown ...
I, [2017-03-29T07:25:09.901537 #15581] INFO -- : Return Value:
::ffff:172.17.0.17 - - [29/Mar/2017:07:25:09 +0000] "GET /remote/cluster_start HTTP/1.1" 400 - 8.9617
[2017-03-29 07:25:09] INFO WEBrick::HTTPServer#start done.

We try to address this by doing two things:
A) We add a --wait switch to the cluster setup which should wait until
   the restart is complete.
B) We add a set of retries to the cluster start statement

While it is likely that either one of these be enough to close this
race, given the elusiveness of the problem (in CI upstream we hit
it twice in the last month), I prefer taking a more comprehensive
approach at closing this window.

Another option would have been to remove the cluster start exec
statement and simply add --start to the cluster setup call. This
approach seems to me like a smaller less invasive change. Since I'd like
to backport this issue to older releases as well, I prefer to not
change the setup code too much at this stage.

Change-Id: I7cdfcbced0031040e9f45ddba7389868bb3f59b2
Closes-Bug: #1677312

commit_message:
Set REMAINING_TIME for local run

When running CI scripts locally it fails because REMAINING_TIME is
propagated by infra before the job starts. This patch sets it to
some default value if it wasn't set before.

Change-Id: I0050046db17e50ddd17a7115e46c4684afa87b2f

commit_message:
Fixes issues with raising mysql file limit

Changes Include:
 - Adds spec testing
 - Only raise limits if nonha.  puppet-systemd will restart the mariadb
   service which breaks ha deployments.  Hence we only want to do this
   in noha.
 - Minor fix to hiera value refrenced not as parameter to mysql.pp

Partial-Bug: #1648181
Related-Bug: #1524809

Co-Authored By: Feng Pan <fpan@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id063bf4b4ac229181b01f40965811cb8ac4230d5
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Feng Pan <fpan@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c9acf8a687ea64686c1ecceeff45add014752121)

commit_message:
Check rabbitmq user at step >= 2

The rabbitmq user check is moved to step >= 2 from step >= 1. There is
no gaurantee that rabbitmq is running at step 1, especially if updating
a failed stack that never made it past step 1 to begin with.

Change-Id: I029193da4c180deff3ab516bc8dc2da14c279317
Closes-Bug: #1675194
(cherry picked from commit aa9af086f05e466e88ac2a85ecc9d39f5a6d1e2f)

commit_message:
For healthchecking the rpc server(s) add a simple healthcheck response

ensure that it is functional, and then expect a response (in this
case 'alive') to know that the server is working.

subject: [zmq]send rpc.call message failed on direct connections dynamic mode
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-03 02:03:50.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/zmq_driver/client/publishers/dealer/zmq_dealer_publisher_direct.py'], 'message': '[zmq]send rpc.call message failed on direct connections dynamic mode

The establishment of the connection is asynchronous in zeromq.
When completed execution acquire_connection() method in class
DealerPublisherDirect, the connection has not been established,
sending a message at this time will fail.So we need a delay 20ms
to wait for the connection establish.

Change-Id: I87eea31b6f0ef48d88873e9a3a2943964bcb52eb
Closes-Bug: #1658913
'}]
commit_message:
[zmq]send rpc.call message failed on direct connections dynamic mode

The establishment of the connection is asynchronous in zeromq.
When completed execution acquire_connection() method in class
DealerPublisherDirect, the connection has not been established,
sending a message at this time will fail.So we need a delay 20ms
to wait for the connection establish.

Change-Id: I87eea31b6f0ef48d88873e9a3a2943964bcb52eb
Closes-Bug: #1658913

subject: [zmq] publisher's socket.send() blocked when restart consumer
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-10 12:31:47.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/zmq_driver/client/zmq_routing_table.py'], 'message': "[zmq] publisher's socket.send() blocked when restart consumer

Fault reason:
After restart consumer,the consumer address in database is invalid,
On direct connections dynamic mode,the publisher update addresses
per 180 seconds.Before the addresses have been updated,the publisher
socket is connected to consumer's invalid address.
When send CALL message,publisher socket's option IMMEDIATE=1.
Messages whill be queued only to completed connections.
This will cause the publisher socket to block.
Solution:
When send messages, the publisher should update the consumer
addresses immediately.

Change-Id: Iedb2a3d5375df41c4a82a198a62bf4e7d5fdaf3c
Closes-Bug: #1663459
"}]
commit_message:
[zmq] publisher's socket.send() blocked when restart consumer

Fault reason:
After restart consumer,the consumer address in database is invalid,
On direct connections dynamic mode,the publisher update addresses
per 180 seconds.Before the addresses have been updated,the publisher
socket is connected to consumer's invalid address.
When send CALL message,publisher socket's option IMMEDIATE=1.
Messages whill be queued only to completed connections.
This will cause the publisher socket to block.
Solution:
When send messages, the publisher should update the consumer
addresses immediately.

Change-Id: Iedb2a3d5375df41c4a82a198a62bf4e7d5fdaf3c
Closes-Bug: #1663459

subject: Fix cluster group migration status checks
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2017-04-03 12:32:49.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/tests/unit/test_base.py', 'os_win/utils/compute/clusterutils.py', 'os_win/tests/unit/utils/compute/test_clusapi_utils.py', 'os_win/exceptions.py', 'os_win/tests/unit/utils/compute/test_clusterutils.py', 'os_win/utils/compute/_clusapi_utils.py'], 'message': "Fix cluster group migration status checks

We incorrectly assumed that the group state will immediately become
'Pending' when a migration is requested, judging by the expected
'ErrorPending' return code of the move function.

This is not the case, as the group can be reported as 'Online' while
being on the source node, before a live migration is actually
performed successfully. This is incorrectly treated as an exception
at the moment.

This change refactors the way in which we check pending migrations.
We rely on cluster group state change events in this matter.

In case of migration timeouts, we're now attempting to cancel pending
migrations.

Also, some of the private methods functionality is now publicly
exposed (e.g. canceling migrations, detecting queued migrations).

In the future, we're planning to implement a custom cluster resource
dll, having a finer control over this.

Closes-Bug: #1628938

Change-Id: I6c268355213718d4d66e0e77a89c558cde3213b6
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cluster group migration status checks

We incorrectly assumed that the group state will immediately become
'Pending' when a migration is requested, judging by the expected
'ErrorPending' return code of the move function.

This is not the case, as the group can be reported as 'Online' while
being on the source node, before a live migration is actually
performed successfully. This is incorrectly treated as an exception
at the moment.

This change refactors the way in which we check pending migrations.
We rely on cluster group state change events in this matter.

In case of migration timeouts, we're now attempting to cancel pending
migrations.

Also, some of the private methods functionality is now publicly
exposed (e.g. canceling migrations, detecting queued migrations).

In the future, we're planning to implement a custom cluster resource
dll, having a finer control over this.

Closes-Bug: #1628938

Change-Id: I6c268355213718d4d66e0e77a89c558cde3213b6

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-09 18:04:03.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/rpc/client.py'], 'message': "WIP: Backing-off RPC Client/Context

DO NOT MERGE: This is a work in progress and needs additional
work. It's provided here as a WIP until oslo cores can agree on
the high level approach at which time docs, tests, etc. will be
added and additional testing done.

Background:
A while back we had a discussion on ML [1] regarding rehoming
some work done in neutron to implement a 'backing off RPC
Client' [2]. This patch implements that topic.

Implementation:
- Minor refactoring to base call context to support a more object
oriented approach suitable to inheritance reuse.
- A new RPCTimeouts class that encapsulates the timeout
configuration as well as a per method cache of current timeout
values.
- A _TimeoutBackoffContext that supports using a RPCTimeout
instance to perform automatic backoff [2] when timeout is not
explicitly passed to prepare().
- A TimeoutBackoffRPCClient class that perpares instance of
_TimeoutBackoffContext. See docstring for sample usage.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-April/092914.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280595/

Change-Id: I675046e10a2b0cff20d9058752a84d975cd2588f
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Backing-off RPC Client/Context

DO NOT MERGE: This is a work in progress and needs additional
work. It's provided here as a WIP until oslo cores can agree on
the high level approach at which time docs, tests, etc. will be
added and additional testing done.

Background:
A while back we had a discussion on ML [1] regarding rehoming
some work done in neutron to implement a 'backing off RPC
Client' [2]. This patch implements that topic.

Implementation:
- Minor refactoring to base call context to support a more object
oriented approach suitable to inheritance reuse.
- A new RPCTimeouts class that encapsulates the timeout
configuration as well as a per method cache of current timeout
values.
- A _TimeoutBackoffContext that supports using a RPCTimeout
instance to perform automatic backoff [2] when timeout is not
explicitly passed to prepare().
- A TimeoutBackoffRPCClient class that perpares instance of
_TimeoutBackoffContext. See docstring for sample usage.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-April/092914.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280595/

Change-Id: I675046e10a2b0cff20d9058752a84d975cd2588f

subject: Should send bytes message in kafka on Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 06:36:53.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_kafka.py'], 'message': "Should send bytes message in kafka on Python 3

There only bytes message is no need to dump, but if we don't dump str
it would send unicode message on Python 3(str is unicode on py3). so
let's replace str with six.binary_type.

ref:
https://github.com/dpkp/kafka-python/blob/master/kafka/producer/base.py#L396

Change-Id: If6e4322468ff25c3d1afd46524ac576cb8cac95d
"}]
commit_message:
Should send bytes message in kafka on Python 3

There only bytes message is no need to dump, but if we don't dump str
it would send unicode message on Python 3(str is unicode on py3). so
let's replace str with six.binary_type.

ref:
https://github.com/dpkp/kafka-python/blob/master/kafka/producer/base.py#L396

Change-Id: If6e4322468ff25c3d1afd46524ac576cb8cac95d

subject: Avoid keystone doctor token size warning
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-31 08:07:04.000000000', 'files': ['templates/keystone.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Avoid keystone doctor token size warning

Keystone doctor recommends setting the max_token_size.
Under Newton, keystone defaults are 8192.

This commit templates the multiple recommended sizes.

Ocata and above don't need the same logic, as the default
is now 255 (but another logic could be applied in a
different commit)

Here is an excerpt of a keystone doctor run:
"
WARNING: `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size` should be adjusted.

This option is intended to protect keystone from unreasonably sized tokens,
where "reasonable" is mostly dependent on the `keystone.conf [token]
provider` that you're using. If you're using one of the following token
providers, then you should set `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size`
accordingly:

- For UUID, set `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size = 32`, because UUID
  tokens are always exactly 32 characters.

- For PKI and PKIZ, set `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size = 8192`,
  because PKI and PKIZ tokens can be quite large, but any larger than 8192
  and they tend to break certain implementations of HTTP.

- For Fernet, set `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size = 255`, because
  Fernet tokens should never exceed this length in most deployments.
  However, if you are also using `keystone.conf [identity] driver = ldap`,
  Fernet tokens may not be built using an efficient packing method,
  depending on the IDs returned from LDAP, resulting in longer Fernet
  tokens (adjust your `max_token_size` accordingly).
"

Change-Id: I3eee4b53d884674900807e48abe82fac97f77987
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid keystone doctor token size warning

Keystone doctor recommends setting the max_token_size.
Under Newton, keystone defaults are 8192.

This commit templates the multiple recommended sizes.

Ocata and above don't need the same logic, as the default
is now 255 (but another logic could be applied in a
different commit)

Here is an excerpt of a keystone doctor run:
"
WARNING: `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size` should be adjusted.

This option is intended to protect keystone from unreasonably sized tokens,
where "reasonable" is mostly dependent on the `keystone.conf [token]
provider` that you're using. If you're using one of the following token
providers, then you should set `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size`
accordingly:

- For UUID, set `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size = 32`, because UUID
  tokens are always exactly 32 characters.

- For PKI and PKIZ, set `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size = 8192`,
  because PKI and PKIZ tokens can be quite large, but any larger than 8192
  and they tend to break certain implementations of HTTP.

- For Fernet, set `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size = 255`, because
  Fernet tokens should never exceed this length in most deployments.
  However, if you are also using `keystone.conf [identity] driver = ldap`,
  Fernet tokens may not be built using an efficient packing method,
  depending on the IDs returned from LDAP, resulting in longer Fernet
  tokens (adjust your `max_token_size` accordingly).
"

Change-Id: I3eee4b53d884674900807e48abe82fac97f77987

commit_message:
Use HostAddressOpt for opts that accept IP and hostnames

Some configuration options were accepting both IP addresses
and hostnames. Since there was no specific OSLO opt type to
support this, we were using ``StrOpt``. The change [1] that
added support for ``HostAddressOpt`` type was merged in Ocata
and became available for use with oslo version 3.22.

This patch changes the opt type of configuration options to use
this more relevant opt type - HostAddressOpt.

[1] I77bdb64b7e6e56ce761d76696bc4448a9bd325eb

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0a9844f88972a594ab02c18349280f4476dd86c7

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-30 15:10:57.000000000', 'files': ['instack_undercloud/validator.py', 'instack_undercloud/tests/test_validator.py'], 'message': "Disable VIP validation when UI is enabled

The UI needs to be accessible from outside the undercloud, which in
many cases means it can't be listening on the provisioning network
because that network is often not routable.

This is somewhat unfortunate because we also have reports that
moving the VIP outside the provisioning network can break

Change-Id: If4e77e3b6fc8444569c2a4672bd270e249436a73
1: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1268451

commit_message:
Disable VIP validation when UI is enabled

The UI needs to be accessible from outside the undercloud, which in
many cases means it can't be listening on the provisioning network
because that network is often not routable.

This is somewhat unfortunate because we also have reports that
moving the VIP outside the provisioning network can break
installation[1], but we have two conflicting requirements here and
the UI takes precedence.  Hopefully if the referenced bug reoccurs
as a result of this change we can investigate further and find a
way to validate that doesn't break the UI.

Change-Id: If4e77e3b6fc8444569c2a4672bd270e249436a73
1: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1268451
Closes-Bug: 1668180
(cherry picked from commit dc14935f9fc44172c53681de86e42bb20ee9ddbd)
(cherry picked from commit e32b025a8c2d87fce1318eed8130d0e4344554b2)

commit_message:
run_tests.sh: Use common test script to run the tox tests

Update the run_tests.sh script to use the common script file
from the openstack-ansible-tests repository in order to keep
the testing logic into a central place and avoid duplication.
This also updates the bindep.txt to match the one from the
openstack-ansible-tests repository. Finally, CentOS7 support
has been added to the Vagrantfile file.

Change-Id: I2339bcf43384d50109ae8e958f70de9e63adbb76

subject: Allow the usage of local facts

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-31 20:06:47.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/container_create.yml'], 'message': "Allow the usage of local facts

Ansible could be used with local facts, but we don't create
the ansible local facts folder by default.

This makes possible to use local facts, with no downside.

Change-Id: I063a8fc9e48514994e0dcf343359a1603d0588bc
(cherry picked from commit 097da38126d90cfca36cdc3955aaf658a00db599)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow the usage of local facts

Ansible could be used with local facts, but we don't create
the ansible local facts folder by default.

This makes possible to use local facts, with no downside.

commit_message:
Skip specific tempest API test

The test test_add_list_remove_router_on_l3_agent fails consistently on
both an AIO and multi-node deployment.  This test passes fine on
stable/newton and later, so simply excluding in stable/mitaka so we can
run the full api test suite.

Change-Id: I295c5afac4294e622f4c2b44e6406f28ba4bf1ce

commit_message:
Run mlock_report under python3

psutil is only installed under python3 for the 3.5 gate jobs.  Call
mlock_report.py with $PYTHON so we support both environments.

Updates to mlock_report.py for python3 compatability

commit_message:
Switch RootHelperProcess from select.poll to select.select

The new eventlet 0.20.x that the gate was recently bumped to [1] removed
select.poll [2]. Instead, we should use select.select that is both
supported by eventlet as well as available on all platforms.

[1] I534b8d7d6c2fa00c1fa7d84b3438e6e2b2fcad9e
[2] http://eventlet.net/doc/changelog.html#id2

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/common/net_helpers.py

Change-Id: Ie649abf495e00e7e05de47520ed89bbcd28360db
Closes-Bug: #1674557
(cherry picked from commit f48dbeda5c4f8f34fb0f56227254ea3b8f830005)

commit_message:
Set SELinux labels properly in Swarm containers

When starting the Docker Swarm containers under Fedora Atomic, the
SELinux labels are not properly set therefore it causes the services
to instantly die, not being able to read the certificate files.

This patch passes a flag to Docker to set the labels properly in
order for the master and the agent to start successfully.

(cherry picked from 0d1d7aa1e0710d3b31fbf1d492d899a49820b25e)

Change-Id: I2e28c3cc4b1b2f7dfb5d1e09dd35bff0f6016481
Closes-Bug: #1678130

commit_message:
Set SELinux labels properly in Swarm containers

When starting the Docker Swarm containers under Fedora Atomic, the
SELinux labels are not properly set therefore it causes the services
to instantly die, not being able to read the certificate files.

This patch passes a flag to Docker to set the labels properly in
order for the master and the agent to start successfully.

Change-Id: I2e28c3cc4b1b2f7dfb5d1e09dd35bff0f6016481
Closes-Bug: #1678130

subject: Rebuild credential-key repo during keystone[0] rebuild
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-22 09:52:06.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/primary-container-rebuild-a2f4d7f33d66c843.yaml', 'tasks/keystone_credential_create.yml'], 'message': 'Rebuild credential-key repo during keystone[0] rebuild

When the first Keystone container is rebult in an existing environment,
the credential key repository is overwritten with new keys and the
existing keys are overwritten on the other infrastructure hosts without
any migration taking place. This results in an irrevocable loss of
the keys used to encrypt the credentials.

Now we will collect keys from any existing credential keys on the other
containers and use them to rebuild the credential-key repo on the primary
container before performing a key migration and rotation.

If no keys are found on the other containers, we will perform a
credential_setup on the primary container and sync the keys, just
as we would have before.

Closes-Bug: #1667960
Change-Id: Ic616d397574573629273838fbf68ea3f6bdb0468
(cherry picked from commit b3425781ecb3dd5082955fa8bb199245d47ddf2e)
'}]
commit_message:
Rebuild credential-key repo during keystone[0] rebuild

When the first Keystone container is rebult in an existing environment,
the credential key repository is overwritten with new keys and the
existing keys are overwritten on the other infrastructure hosts without
any migration taking place. This results in an irrevocable loss of
the keys used to encrypt the credentials.

Now we will collect keys from any existing credential keys on the other
containers and use them to rebuild the credential-key repo on the primary
container before performing a key migration and rotation.

If no keys are found on the other containers, we will perform a
credential_setup on the primary container and sync the keys, just
as we would have before.

Closes-Bug: #1667960
Change-Id: Ic616d397574573629273838fbf68ea3f6bdb0468
(cherry picked from commit b3425781ecb3dd5082955fa8bb199245d47ddf2e)

commit_message:
Use absolute path to runlevel binary in umm

There is no PATH profile load in that script. So when it invoked by
pacemaker we have to use abosolute path.

Change-Id: I7eca95667c2711f9611c87ff58c02487dbdc019c
Picked-From: Idcde2e87eb14089e4a152f5936d0ea197faa0793
Closes-Bug: #1528686
Related-Bug: #1558963

subject: hyper-v: Adds support for VMs with nested virtualization
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-04-01 12:08:07.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/vmops.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_vmops.py'], 'message': 'hyper-v: Adds support for VMs with nested virtualization

Nested virtualization is a new feature introduced in
Windows / Hyper-V Server 2016.

The nova Hyper-V Driver will enable nested virtualization for
an instance if the given instance flavor extra_specs
"hw:cpu_features" or the given instance image property
"hw_cpu_features" contains the CPU feature "vmx".

An instance with nested virtualization enabled, cannot have
dynamic memory.

Depends-On: I238161a8cd1d589a7d57fe9cf74b18b22679998c

Change-Id: I3c97baa76fa5fd4689b622cf554b471f87f6c723
Implements: blueprint hyper-v-nested-virtualization
'}]
commit_message:
hyper-v: Adds support for VMs with nested virtualization

Nested virtualization is a new feature introduced in
Windows / Hyper-V Server 2016.

The nova Hyper-V Driver will enable nested virtualization for
an instance if the given instance flavor extra_specs
"hw:cpu_features" or the given instance image property
"hw_cpu_features" contains the CPU feature "vmx".

An instance with nested virtualization enabled, cannot have
dynamic memory.

Depends-On: I238161a8cd1d589a7d57fe9cf74b18b22679998c

Change-Id: I3c97baa76fa5fd4689b622cf554b471f87f6c723
Implements: blueprint hyper-v-nested-virtualization

commit_message:
Changes the defaut port name for OVS

This patch changes the default OVS port name to be
generated in the same way as for Linux
in order to maintain consistency.
This patch also fixes an issue with the native
implementation of OVS on Windows.

Change-Id: I84bf00a86dffca44b5007742cba1ac78a41b3f85

commit_message:
Adding the mistral packages to tripleo-ci-master

In order to develop and test mistral, mistralclient and tripleoclient
we need the master versions (or as close as we can get to master) of
the mistral installed. Right now to test it we are manually patching
this file but it seems reasonable to me to have those in the
tripleo-ci-master

The use of the wild card is because mistral is split in 4 packages
openstack-mistral-common
openstack-mistral-api
openstack-mistral-engine
openstack-mistral-executor


Change-Id: Ib4ac46619865faa24858b15b58fa76a87ad6ea60

subject: Tests helper function _send_requests should catch socket.error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-30 23:01:31.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/tests/tempest/v2/scenario/base.py'], 'message': "Tests helper function _send_requests should catch socket.error

Some tests, such as test_listener_basic for example, use helper function
_send_requests() to send traffic to a loadbalancer both in a positive
(expect to succeed) and negative (expect to fail) context.

In a case of a negative context,  _send_requests() currently won't catch
socket.error, which is a valid response from a loadbalancer in a case of
a request rejection.

F5's LBaaS driver replays with TCP RST in a case of request rejection and
they confirmed[1] that adding by catching socket.error in
_send_requests() tests work as expected.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/octavia/+bug/1675702/comments/2

Change-Id: Iab001fc31ce81b2fd5e8e87333fa9a3391ecda99
Closes-Bug: #1675702
"}]
commit_message:
Tests helper function _send_requests should catch socket.error

Some tests, such as test_listener_basic for example, use helper function
_send_requests() to send traffic to a loadbalancer both in a positive
(expect to succeed) and negative (expect to fail) context.

In a case of a negative context,  _send_requests() currently won't catch
socket.error, which is a valid response from a loadbalancer in a case of
a request rejection.

F5's LBaaS driver replays with TCP RST in a case of request rejection and
they confirmed[1] that adding by catching socket.error in
_send_requests() tests work as expected.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/octavia/+bug/1675702/comments/2

Change-Id: Iab001fc31ce81b2fd5e8e87333fa9a3391ecda99
Closes-Bug: #1675702

subject: Fixes port binding controller for OpenDaylight
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4727, 'name': 'Itzik Brown', 'email': 'itzikb@redhat.com', 'username': 'itzikb1'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11420, 'name': 'Nir Yechiel', 'email': 'nyechiel@redhat.com', 'username': 'nyechiel'}, {'_account_id': 17280, 'name': 'Tim Rozet', 'email': 'trozet@redhat.com', 'username': 'trozet'}, {'_account_id': 18575, 'name': 'Saravanan KR', 'email': 'krsacme@gmail.com', 'username': 'saravanankr'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-27 20:20:11.000000000', 'files': ['environments/neutron-opendaylight.yaml', 'puppet/services/neutron-plugin-ml2-odl.yaml'], 'message': 'Fixes port binding controller for OpenDaylight

In Ocata and later, the port binding controller for ODL was changed by
default to be the pseudo agent controller, which requires a new feature
"host config" for OVS.  This patch modifies the default to use
network-topology, which will work without any new host config features
implemented (previous way of port binding).

Closes-Bug: 1675211

Depends-On: I5004fdeb238dea81bc4f7e9437843a8a080d5b46

Change-Id: I6a6969d1d6b8d8b8ac31fecd57af85eb653245d2
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes port binding controller for OpenDaylight

In Ocata and later, the port binding controller for ODL was changed by
default to be the pseudo agent controller, which requires a new feature
"host config" for OVS.  This patch modifies the default to use
network-topology, which will work without any new host config features
implemented (previous way of port binding).

Closes-Bug: 1675211

Depends-On: I5004fdeb238dea81bc4f7e9437843a8a080d5b46

Change-Id: I6a6969d1d6b8d8b8ac31fecd57af85eb653245d2
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: make emulator threads to run on the reserved pCPU

In this commit we finally make libvirt to use the pCPU reserved to pin
emulator threads.

implements blueprint libvirt-emulator-threads-policy

Change-Id: I25baf488b1c8a3959bdd6abe3ce3c1f6429b6eab

commit_message:
Cinder move drivers/plugins to external libs

subject: neutron: retrieve physical network name from a multi-provider network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-03 10:33:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/constants.py'], 'message': 'neutron: retrieve physical network name from a multi-provider network

Multi-provider networks are a combination of vxlan and vlan networks.
such a network has a special "segments" field that holds a list
of networks. Each element of this list has the same structure as the 'provider
network attributes'.
These attributes are:
- provider:network_type
- provider:physical_network
- provider:segmentation_id

This patch will retrieve the relevant physical network name from a
multi-provider network

Change-Id: Icb9a546e6fcbf399fcef3e9ea686b35ec3817cd5
Closes-Bug: #1676513
(cherry picked from commit 56a7e2ae0ad7f31e078b7e145c31bb3a45b541e5)
'}]
commit_message:
neutron: retrieve physical network name from a multi-provider network

Multi-provider networks are a combination of vxlan and vlan networks.
such a network has a special "segments" field that holds a list
of networks. Each element of this list has the same structure as the 'provider
network attributes'.
These attributes are:
- provider:network_type
- provider:physical_network
- provider:segmentation_id

This patch will retrieve the relevant physical network name from a
multi-provider network

Change-Id: Icb9a546e6fcbf399fcef3e9ea686b35ec3817cd5
Closes-Bug: #1676513
(cherry picked from commit 56a7e2ae0ad7f31e078b7e145c31bb3a45b541e5)

By default coverage looks for os-net-config, but since that's not
a valid python package name the actual package is called
os_net_config.  This change correctly specifies that.

Change-Id: I5949ad2380942440f74397c2d74c94bc6ef3c55d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix coverage tox config

By default coverage looks for os-net-config, but since that's not
a valid python package name the actual package is called
os_net_config.  This change correctly specifies that.

Change-Id: I5949ad2380942440f74397c2d74c94bc6ef3c55d

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I635981726bf2da9558ed451ce6f3ab06c9e04edc

commit_message:
Remove deprecated, untested ipminative driver

The ipminative driver was marked as unsupported on September 28, 2016,
and an email was sent to the list on March 9th, 2017 asking for
volunteers to run third-party CI to save the driver from deprecation.

Additionally, many ironic contributors who also deploy ironic have
reported instability while using this driver. For these reasons it's
being removed from the main ironic tree. If there are any users still
interested in this driver, they are invited to host it elsewhere.

Change-Id: I9bc9f4cbd916f040a636b967ec5556197ad3d8a8
Closes-bug: #1671532

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-30 07:55:08.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/tests/unit/test_model_proxy.py', 'dragonflow/db/model_proxy.py'], 'message': 'Support equality for model instances

when a model has a reference and 2 instances of it have same fields,
current code will not see them as equal. The proxied field in different
instances will be seen as different, even if they refer to same object.

This patch add __eq__ to _ModelProxyBase to make proxied field equal
when they refer to same object.

Change-Id: I963e6f96d6838d7f354a8c74070f4d8008234b24
Partially-Implements: bp refactor-nb-api
'}]
commit_message:
Support equality for model instances

when a model has a reference and 2 instances of it have same fields,
current code will not see them as equal. The proxied field in different
instances will be seen as different, even if they refer to same object.

This patch add __eq__ to _ModelProxyBase to make proxied field equal
when they refer to same object.

Change-Id: I963e6f96d6838d7f354a8c74070f4d8008234b24
Partially-Implements: bp refactor-nb-api

can re-apply all data to local. It is useful when the df controller

Change-Id: Iebbe31e9aa32b7d4c9359a26ea37a9f676362720
Partially-Implements: blueprint refactor-nb-api

commit_message:
Add clear method to new local cache

The `clear` method in the db_store is required, so that the full_sync
can re-apply all data to local. It is useful when the df controller
is reconnected.

Change-Id: Iebbe31e9aa32b7d4c9359a26ea37a9f676362720
Partially-Implements: blueprint refactor-nb-api

subject: Check all resources with custom guidelines
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-22 10:35:47.000000000', 'files': ['tools/custom_guidelines.py'], 'message': "Check all resources with custom guidelines

If resource has available_resource_mapping method and
it's not available, custom guidelines check will skip it,
which is incorrect. This patch improves list of resources:
now only hidden, contrib and manually excluded resources
don't checked.

Change-Id: Ic2cb37fb3fe4aefb8b3efb911aecf46155541469
Closes-bug: #1674949
"}]
commit_message:
Check all resources with custom guidelines

If resource has available_resource_mapping method and
it's not available, custom guidelines check will skip it,
which is incorrect. This patch improves list of resources:
now only hidden, contrib and manually excluded resources
don't checked.

Change-Id: Ic2cb37fb3fe4aefb8b3efb911aecf46155541469
Closes-bug: #1674949

commit_message:
Add special case upgrade from openvswitch 2.5.0-14

In [1] we removed the previously used special case upgrade code.
However we have since discovered that for openvswitch 2.5.0-14
the special case is still required with an extra flag to prevent
the restart.  This adds the upgrade code back into the minor
update and 'manual upgrade' scripts for compute/swift. The
review at If998704b3c4199bbae8a1d068c31a71763f5c8a2 is adding
this logic for the ansible upgrade steps.

Related-Bug: 1669714
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/59e5f9597eb37f69045e470eb457b878728477d7
Change-Id: I3e5899e2d831b89745b2f37e61ff69dbf83ff595
(cherry picked from commit 25983882c2f7a8e8f8fb83bd967a67d008a556a4)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 2011, 'name': 'Ian Main', 'email': 'imain@redhat.com', 'username': 'imain'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Ji≈ô√≠ Str√°nsk√Ω', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 13039, 'name': 'Martin Andr√©', 'email': 'm.andre@redhat.com', 'username': 'mandre'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-03-14 13:52:55.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/database/mysql.yaml'], 'message': "Keep existing data when moving to containerized MariaDB

We used named Docker volume for MariaDB storage, which meant that when
moving from BM to containerized wit MariaDB, we lost data and
reinitialized the storage from scratch.

With this commit we keep the data by mounting the original data into the
container.

We also need to make sure that file ownership is correct according to
the MariaDB container image used, and that Kolla bootstrap mechanisms
aren't retriggered, as they aren't idempotent.

Change-Id: I1fc955021c6dd83f1a366495dd8c7281fb9e7cc5
"}]
commit_message:
Keep existing data when moving to containerized MariaDB

We used named Docker volume for MariaDB storage, which meant that when
moving from BM to containerized wit MariaDB, we lost data and
reinitialized the storage from scratch.

With this commit we keep the data by mounting the original data into the
container.

We also need to make sure that file ownership is correct according to
the MariaDB container image used, and that Kolla bootstrap mechanisms
aren't retriggered, as they aren't idempotent.

Change-Id: I1fc955021c6dd83f1a366495dd8c7281fb9e7cc5

commit_message:
Test and fixups for ContainerSharder config

Adds a config_float_value function in utils to provide a common
helper for loading values that are expected to be a float with
min and max constraints.

Use that function in ContainerSharder.__init__, and also use the
existing config_positive_int_value

Fix some typos and omissions in the container-server.conf-sample

Change-Id: Icc8c5273c292a3b3572087a180b61e5cc5adedcf

subject: Ignore dependency errors with conditions
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-12 20:52:38.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_rsrc_defn.py', 'heat/engine/rsrc_defn.py', 'heat/tests/test_hot.py'], 'message': "Ignore dependency errors with conditions

If a resource is conditionally defined, depending on it raises an error
in the case it's not defined. This patch fixes that by checking if the
resource is present in the template regardless of the conditions.

Change-Id: Iefae1fcea720bee4ed69ad1a5fe403d52d54433c
Closes-Bug: #1649900
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore dependency errors with conditions

If a resource is conditionally defined, depending on it raises an error
in the case it's not defined. This patch fixes that by checking if the
resource is present in the template regardless of the conditions.

Change-Id: Iefae1fcea720bee4ed69ad1a5fe403d52d54433c
Closes-Bug: #1649900

subject: Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-10 08:13:09.000000000', 'files': ['heat-config-docker-compose/install.d/hook-docker-compose.py'], 'message': 'Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if
you receive a YAML document from an untrusted source
such as the Internet. The function yaml.safe_load()
limits this ability to simple Python objects like
integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I63ce1f2db4dce895f3027bcf5e47edb51b26d40b
'}]
commit_message:
Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if
you receive a YAML document from an untrusted source
such as the Internet. The function yaml.safe_load()
limits this ability to simple Python objects like
integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I63ce1f2db4dce895f3027bcf5e47edb51b26d40b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-02 02:07:53.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_hook_docker_cmd.py', 'heat-config-docker-cmd/install.d/hook-docker-cmd.py'], 'message': "Split string commands on whitespace

This change supports specifying commands as strings by spliting the
string into a list using python's default whitespace string split().

This will handle simple string commands but not cases like
quoted/escaped spaces. Other cases can be handled by specifying the
command as a list instead.

Change-Id: Icc4eebe324a4e6a7dd06f697ef16d38777f90861
"}]
commit_message:
Split string commands on whitespace

This change supports specifying commands as strings by spliting the
string into a list using python's default whitespace string split().

This will handle simple string commands but not cases like
quoted/escaped spaces. Other cases can be handled by specifying the
command as a list instead.

Change-Id: Icc4eebe324a4e6a7dd06f697ef16d38777f90861

subject: Handle re-created resources in StackUpdateManager
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-30 10:30:23.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/test_stack_update.py', 'tripleo_common/_stack_update.py'], 'message': 'Handle re-created resources in StackUpdateManager

Since Iaacc585b9806c08fd5a57c80c10eeb31cb0a8f71 got merged in Heat, we
can get into a state where a failed resource is recreated during update
after clearing a hook. That means that when we poll for events, we need
to check for that additional action and not limit to updates.

Change-Id: I2191a3f3df426eaa91fdd5b00299193a32efe366
Closes-Bug: #1677548
'}]
commit_message:
Handle re-created resources in StackUpdateManager

Since Iaacc585b9806c08fd5a57c80c10eeb31cb0a8f71 got merged in Heat, we
can get into a state where a failed resource is recreated during update
after clearing a hook. That means that when we poll for events, we need
to check for that additional action and not limit to updates.

Change-Id: I2191a3f3df426eaa91fdd5b00299193a32efe366
Closes-Bug: #1677548

commit_message:
Scenarios manager: inline some not-so-used methods

In the spirit of reducing the size of the scenarios manager, we should
remove all the methods and functions that don"t really belong to the base
class. This patch removes the _update_router_admin_state and _log_net_info
methods.

Change-Id: I2ce28d6b46bd67cf4135ab56eb226e13d7b2b334

subject: Fix return code when failing before launching the stack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-16 11:21:28.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py', 'releasenotes/notes/return-code-on-predeploy-failure-bd62025646e25433.yaml', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': "Fix return code when failing before launching the stack

Until now when a configuration error was detected early during the
pre-deployment verifications, the command would correctly return before
attempting to create/update the Heat stack, however the return code
would still show as '0', preventing scripts from picking up the
problem.

Change-Id: I8bd16e9753618e4c234440d7a6626e0ce4bd9972
Closes-Bug: #1672790
"}]
commit_message:
Fix return code when failing before launching the stack

Until now when a configuration error was detected early during the
pre-deployment verifications, the command would correctly return before
attempting to create/update the Heat stack, however the return code
would still show as '0', preventing scripts from picking up the
problem.

Change-Id: I8bd16e9753618e4c234440d7a6626e0ce4bd9972
Closes-Bug: #1672790

commit_message:
Retire os-cloud-config

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/114749.html

It was deprecated in Ocata, we want to remove it in Pike.
Nobody uses it now and the module is useless.
Let's remove it from OpenStack.

commit_message:
Update ARA's Ansible version with releases for 2.1.x, 2.2.x and 2.3.x

Ansible recently released version 2.1.5.0 and 2.2.2.0.
There is also 2.3.0.0 which is currently in rc2.

-latest and 2.2.2.0 will both run 2.2.2.0 until 2.3.0.0 is released
but when 2.3 is released, -latest will pick it up automatically.

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-03-10 17:52:05.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/manila.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': '[Manila] Add 2 jobs for manila-image-elements project

For the moment, we have jobs that just build images for this
project, but they are not tested for usage with appropriate drivers.

So, add two tempest jobs, that will use built image with proposed
changes to "manila-image-elements" project and use it for manila
'generic' and 'container' (docker) drivers.

Add those jobs only to check pipeline and make them non-voting.

Change-Id: I3698044bbcaa94bddcfa192841520b4d7ea32016
'}]
commit_message:
[Manila] Add 2 jobs for manila-image-elements project

For the moment, we have jobs that just build images for this
project, but they are not tested for usage with appropriate drivers.

So, add two tempest jobs, that will use built image with proposed
changes to "manila-image-elements" project and use it for manila
'generic' and 'container' (docker) drivers.

Add those jobs only to check pipeline and make them non-voting.

Change-Id: I3698044bbcaa94bddcfa192841520b4d7ea32016

subject: Add a new project sushy-tools
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-28 12:34:53.000000000', 'files': ['gerritbot/channels.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'gerrit/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/sushy-tools.config'], 'message': 'Add a new project sushy-tools

This patch is adding a new project called "sushy-tools". This new
project will contain a set of tools to help with the development and
tests of the Sushy library.

Currently, these tools lives in the Sushy repository itself but they
have different requirements than the library itself (such as libvirt for
the simulator) so it makes sense to split it in another repository which
can be installed separately.

Needed-By: I880d9058408792f0c5d9f6531ae8ea06e06229ea
Change-Id: I2ff0299072e86dcf394e438ed2b6e443156a54e8
'}]
commit_message:
Add a new project sushy-tools

This patch is adding a new project called "sushy-tools". This new
project will contain a set of tools to help with the development and
tests of the Sushy library.

Currently, these tools lives in the Sushy repository itself but they
have different requirements than the library itself (such as libvirt for
the simulator) so it makes sense to split it in another repository which
can be installed separately.

Needed-By: I880d9058408792f0c5d9f6531ae8ea06e06229ea
Change-Id: I2ff0299072e86dcf394e438ed2b6e443156a54e8

commit_message:
Uninstall postfix on nodes if it's there

centos installs this by default in centos-minimal. But we don't
need/want an MTA on our single-use nodes. So uninstall it.

Change-Id: Ib5fb99714d31ac8f52bac075eec70684c4220959

commit_message:
Skip pre-caching /deb- repositories in nodepool images

Building a nodepool image is incredibly slow due to the git repo
precaching and it doesn't help that everything is cached twice.

Change-Id: I665bda6cde29aea9ad5285d8d6981ad9c19fc5a7

commit_message:
Add experimental murano functional test gate.

This gate will be used for running murano-ci functional tests
for openstack/murano repository only. It is meant as a replacement
for murano-ci, hosted on Mirantis servers, so that infra can
maintain the gate.

Initially it will be run in the experimental pipeline only. Once
the gates pass, they will be promoted to non-voting/voting.

Change-Id: Ibd043dbc656d95d470b709c4bae0c96d3625106f

subject: Tweak hooks for golang dsvm job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-02 14:50:29.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/golang-jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'Tweak hooks for golang dsvm job

$BASE is not yet defined when the gate hooks are
registered, so we cannot check for the existence
of those files. Instead we check the existence of
files when the hooks are run. Also if the gate
hook is not defined then we do what is usually
done which is to run the devstack-vm-gate.sh script

Change-Id: I8e664f6633289a8514834598d72f82cc403497f4
'}]
commit_message:
Tweak hooks for golang dsvm job

$BASE is not yet defined when the gate hooks are
registered, so we cannot check for the existence
of those files. Instead we check the existence of
files when the hooks are run. Also if the gate
hook is not defined then we do what is usually
done which is to run the devstack-vm-gate.sh script

Change-Id: I8e664f6633289a8514834598d72f82cc403497f4

commit_message:
Remove gate-novaclient-dsvm-functional-mitaka-ubuntu-trusty-nv

This job only runs against master branch changes and uses
nova-network in a mitaka server configuration.

With change I8c520100a0016eed3959619c71dae037ebd72939, novaclient
will no longer work with a nova-network backed server, so it
no longer serves a purpose.

Change-Id: I63b36fb8acc5c9a273e6adcb271df16d0f71031e

commit_message:
Add validation for security_groups parameter in Port

Currently, we check whether specified value in list
matches with UUID format or not.
However, we don't check whether data type of specified value of
security_groups key is list in the first place.
This patch adds check above.

Change-Id: If027df3ff34b219e4a043934b9461ac0fcb40156
Closes-Bug: #1477921
